0.title: Rhea, Sushant's flatmate Siddharth abetted the actor's extreme drug addiction: NCB
0.article_body: The NCB in its draft charge against 35 accused booked in the alleged drugs case filed after Sushant Singh Rajput's death said they entered a criminal conspiracy for distribution of drugs in Bollywood. Drugs were procured for Sushant by his flatmate Siddharth Pithani, Rhea Chakraborty and others who "aided and abetted" the actor to "extreme drug addiction", it added.

1.title: Genetically engineered pig hearts successfully transplanted into 2 dead people in US
1.article_body: A team at NYU Langone Health successfully transplanted two genetically engineered pig hearts into recently deceased humans with an aim to provide an alternative supply of organs for people with life-threatening heart disease amid shortages. The surgeries were performed over several hours and heart function was monitored for three days. No signs of early rejection were observed in either organ.

2.title: India is mother of all democracies: PM Modi in Bihar
2.article_body: Addressing an event in Bihar, PM Narendra Modi said that India is not just the largest democracy but it is also the "mother of all democracies". The PM also stated that the nation was "on its way to becoming a mature democracy" which was evident from "better attendance of lawmakers inside Parliament and state assemblies" and "discarding of obsolete laws".

3.title: 1 dead, 2 seriously injured in landslide in Vasai in Maharashtra's Palghar
3.article_body: At least one person died and two others were seriously injured in a landslide incident in the Vasai area of Maharashtra's Palghar district amid heavy rains, the District Collector said. At least two persons have been rescued so far and three are still feared trapped. Local firemen rescued a woman and her daughter from their house, officials said.

4.title: If Kohli doesn't play the next game, then it would be more than a niggle: Ojha
4.article_body: Ex-India spinner Pragyan Ojha has said if Virat Kohli doesn't play in the second ODI against England, then his injury could be more than a "mild groin strain". He stated that Kohli should be fit if he's suffering from a niggle. However, according to a report, Kohli is yet to recover and is unlikely to play in the second ODI.

5.title: We support tribals: Aaditya Thackeray on Shiv Sena supporting Murmu
5.article_body: Soon after ex-Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray announced that Shiv Sena will support Droupadi Murmu for Presidential polls, Aaditya Thackeray said his party has decided to do so as Murmu is a tribal woman. "Today we've different political views but Droupadi Murmu is a tribal woman and we support tribals. That's why we will vote in favour of Murmu," he added.

6.title: LGBTQ members allege harassment by police at Pune event
6.article_body: The organisers of a private LGBTQ event held in Pune on July 9 have complained of harassment by the police. Writing to the Police Commissioner, they alleged that police locked around 150 members of their community inside the event venue without a warrant. "They...proceeded to use homophobic and derogatory statements," the founder of Mist LGBTQ Foundation told The Indian Express.

7.title: Rishi Kapoor & I argued, fought with each other: Karan on Agneepath
7.article_body: Karan Malhotra, the director of Hrithik Roshan-starrer 'Agneepath' which also featured late actor Rishi Kapoor, said, "[Rishi and I] would argue [and] fight...[over] the character arc." Karan added that they threw challenges at each other. "[Rishi] was...very flamboyant, loud...and...confrontational," he had earlier stated. Karan has directed Ranbir Kapoor-starrer 'Shamshera'.

8.title: 5 held in UP's Prayagraj for anti-Modi poster, T'gana man likely involved
8.article_body: The Prayagraj Police arrested five people in connection with an anti-Modi poster that was put up in the city. The police named a man hailing from Telangana as the prime accused in the matter. The accused have been booked under IPC Section 153B (hurting religious sentiments) and Section 505 (2) (statements creating and promoting enmity, hatred, or ill-will between classes).

9.title: 9 years on, the bond is still strong with Rohit Sharma: Shikhar Dhawan
9.article_body: After India openers Shikhar Dhawan and Rohit Sharma remained unbeaten to chase down England's 111-run target in their first ODI on Tuesday, Dhawan tweeted a picture of him and Rohit and wrote, "Nine years on, the bond is still strong Rohit." In the match, the duo became the fourth opening pair in ODI cricket to complete 5,000 runs in partnership.

10.title: Bradley Cooper is dating Hillary Clinton's former top aide Huma Abedin: Report
10.article_body: Bradley Cooper is dating Huma Abedin, the former top aide to Hillary Clinton and former wife of politician Anthony Weiner, according to Page Six. They were reportedly introduced by Vogue editor Anna Wintour, who is close to both Cooper and Abedin. The couple arrived together at the Met Gala event, however, they parted ways for the red carpet, reports claimed.

11.title: US First Lady apologises after saying Latinos unique as 'breakfast tacos'
11.article_body: US First Lady Jill Biden has apologised for saying Latinos are as unique as "breakfast tacos". "The First Lady apologises that her words conveyed anything but pure admiration and love for...Latino community," her spokesperson said. Condemning Biden's comments, National Association of Hispanic Journalists had said, "We're not tacos. Our heritage as Latinos...shouldn't be reduced to a stereotype."

12.title: Anand Mahindra shares edited pic showing 'future of UK PM's residence'; it goes viral
12.article_body: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra took to Twitter to share an edited picture showing the "future of UK PM's residence". "The future of 10 Downing Street? The famed British humour is now laced with Desi humour," Mahindra wrote. Mahindra shared the picture as Rishi Sunak, who has Indian roots, is one of the contenders for UK Prime Minister's post.

13.title: 47-yr-old woman found dead in lodge in Mumbai, boyfriend absconding
13.article_body: A 47-year-old woman was found dead in a lodge near Aksa Beach in Mumbai's Malad on Tuesday evening, an official said. The man, reportedly her boyfriend, is absconding, he added. The two had checked into the lodge on Monday night and began fighting soon after, he further said. "On Tuesday morning, the man left the place," the official stated.

14.title: TMC insulted Goddess Kali, now disrespecting National Emblem: Irani
14.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Tuesday reacted to TMC's criticism of the National Emblem atop the new Parliament building. "It is not unexpected from the party and its leaders who insult Goddess Kali to insult the National Emblem," Irani said. "Those leaders who...either disregarded or discarded the Constitution over the years, are expected to oppose the National Emblem," she added.

15.title: Religious conversion leads to separatism: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat
15.article_body: Religious conversion should not be done as it separates individuals from their roots, RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said on Tuesday. "Religious conversion leads to separatism. Conversion separates one from the roots. Hence, we should strive to stop religious conversion," Bhagwat added. "We have to ensure that 'dharma' should pervade all over," he stated.

16.title: Mistaking it for road, man drives into overflowing lake in Thane; rescued
16.article_body: Locals rescued a cab driver in Thane after he reportedly drove into the overflowing Phadke Pada lake. The water from the lake was flowing on the road, making it invisible to motorists. "I was new to the area...I could see farmland on the right...there was only water on the left...I was unaware that there was a lake there," driver said.

17.title: Mumbai civic body to start doorstep checks for hypertension, diabetes
17.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation has started to train over 3,000 Community Health Volunteers (CHVs), who will be conducting door-to-door screening for diabetes and hypertension across Mumbai. CHVs will identify suspects and direct them to nearest dispensary for confirmatory test. The civic body took the step after it learnt that cases related to non-communicable diseases are on the rise.

18.title: Rhea received drugs and handed them over to Sushant Singh Rajput: Draft charges
18.article_body: According to draft charges submitted against Rhea Chakraborty in a Special NDPS court, the actress received deliveries of drugs from Samuel Miranda, Showik Chakraborty, Dipesh Sawant and others, and handed over those deliveries to late actor Sushant Singh Rajput. The draft also states that delivery of drugs for the actor had been taking place since 2018.

19.title: National flag, Coast Guard flags found lying in garbage in Kerala; case filed
19.article_body: A case has been registered after the National flag and the Coast Guard flags were found lying in the garbage in Kochi's Irumpanam region on Tuesday. Besides flags, life jackets and raincoats of the Coast Guard were also found dumped by locals. According to police, the items might have been handed over to be disposed of by the Coast Guard.

20.title: Indian School of Business opens admissions for full-time PGP programme
20.article_body: The Indian School of Business has announced that it is now accepting admission applications for its Post Graduate Programme in Management (PGP). The one-year full-time programme has been ranked no. 1 in India and fourth in Asia by FT World MBA Rankings 2022. The programme endows young managers with multidisciplinary perspectives and global exposure, ISB stated.

21.title: Shiv Sena spokesperson Sheetal Mhatre joins Eknath Shinde camp
21.article_body: Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena party spokesperson and former Mumbai corporator Sheetal Mhatre on Tuesday joined the Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde-led Sena camp. Mhatre, along with some Sena workers, visited Shinde's residence on Tuesday night and expressed their support for him. She had represented ward number 7 in suburban Dahisar in north Mumbai in 2012 and 2017.

22.title: Sena part of MVA but didn’t consult us: Cong leader on Shiv Sena's support to Murmu
22.article_body: Congress leader Balasaheb Thorat said Shiv Sena didn't consult his party before deciding to support Droupadi Murmu for Presidential polls. "Though Shiv Sena is part of MVA, it didn't consult us about this," he said. Everyone who supports the "Constitution and democracy" is supporting the Opposition's candidate for Presidential polls, Yashwant Sinha, for the post, Thorat added.

23.title: 20-year-old dies of electrocution at Sinhagad road in Pune
23.article_body: A 20-year-old youth was electrocuted after coming in contact with a live wire near Sawai hotel on Pune's Sinhagad road. The electricity company, MSEDCL, said that a broken cable without electricity was hanging on the footpath. "To remove the wire, [the deceased] pulled it. The...cable came in contact with high tension live cable resulting in his death," MSEDCL said.

24.title: In pics: First images of unseen Universe captured by NASA's Webb Telescope
24.article_body: NASA has revealed James Webb Space Telescope's first full-colour images of the unseen Universe. These images include Carina Nebula - the landscape of 'mountains' and 'valleys' speckled with glittering stars, Stephan's Quintet - a grouping of five galaxies showing huge shockwaves and tidal tails, and Southern Ring Nebula which shows a dying star cloaked by dust and layers of light.

25.title: India reports 16,906 COVID-19 cases in 24 hours, 24% higher than yesterday
25.article_body: India has reported 16,906 COVID-19 cases, 15,447 recoveries and 45 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 13,615 cases and 20 deaths. Notably, India's active COVID-19 cases jumped to 1,32,457, while the death toll reached 5,25,519.

26.title: DMRC junks MetroLite plan for Red Line extension
26.article_body: The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) has dropped the plan to run MetroLite, sleeker, tram-like trains, for Red Line extension. MetroLite was initially planned for the area as they were projected to have a limited ridership, but it has been revised due to Delhi government's plans to create a transit-oriented hub in Narela, DMRC MD Vikas Kumar said.

27.title: India responds after reports claim India helped Sri Lanka President escape
27.article_body: After reports claimed that India helped Sri Lanka President Gotabaya Rajapaksa escape, High Commission of India in Colombo said, "High Commission categorically denies baseless and speculative media reports." "It's reiterated that India will continue to support people of Sri Lanka as they seek to realize their aspirations for prosperity and progress through democratic means and values," it added.

28.title: Exciting to get seam and swing in white-ball cricket: Bumrah on 6/19 vs Eng
28.article_body: Talking about his career-best figures of 6/19 in the first ODI against England, Jasprit Bumrah said it was exciting to get swing and seam movement in a white-ball match. "When I bowled the first ball, I found some swing and we tried to exploit that...When the wicket is flat your accuracy is tested," he added. Shami registered figures of 3/31.

29.title: People didn't have any expectations from me: Actress Taapsee Pannu
29.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu, who will feature in Shah Rukh Khan-starrer ‘Dunki’, said people never expected anything from her as an actress. "It is good to have [such] people,” added Taapsee. “I had three-four flops in South and...started getting tagged as the bad luck charm and someone who shouldn’t be cast in movies because she’s just jinxing,” she had earlier stated.

30.title: Want to con SS Rajamouli into making a film starring only me: Ranbir
30.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor has jokingly said he wants to "con" filmmaker SS Rajamouli into making a film starring only him which will be shot on an island. "I [also want to] kiss Lionel Messi's left foot," added Ranbir. Rajamouli earlier termed Ranbir as his favourite actor in Bollywood. "You can feel the [performance's] intensity...through his eyes and subtle expressions," he'd said.

31.title: We came 3rd in two-horse race: Buttler on 10-wicket defeat in 1st India ODI
31.article_body: England white-ball captain Jos Buttler said they "came third in a two-horse race" after losing the first ODI against India by 10 wickets on Tuesday. He added, "It's tough to take but we've got to dust ourselves down quickly for [the next] game." Buttler further said they knew the ball might swing in "muggy conditions" but India "exploited conditions fantastically".

32.title: Population explosion not a problem of any religion but entire country: Naqvi
32.article_body: BJP leader Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi has said that "population explosion" is not a problem of any religion but an issue for the entire country. It is not right to associate it with caste and religion, Naqvi added. "Some people want to create unlimited problems on the pretext of Allah’s mercy," Naqvi stated.

33.title: Don't allow swearing-in of ministers till SC's verdict: Sena to Maha Guv
33.article_body: Shiv Sena wrote to Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari stating that since a petition seeking the disqualification of 16 legislators was pending in Supreme Court (SC), he should not allow the swearing-in of any minister until the court's decision. "Rewarding persons against whom disqualification proceedings are pending...would be destructive of the Constitutional scheme," the letter added.

34.title: 32 fish kill incidents recorded across B'luru lakes in last 5 yrs: Report
34.article_body: About 32 fish kill incidents were reported across Bengaluru lakes in the last five years, said a report by non-profit organisation ActionAid Association. Of these, eight incidents took place in the last seven months, it added. Based on the number of fish deaths, the report further identified Madiwala, Haralur, Bellandur and Kommaghatta lakes as most vulnerable to fish kill incidents.

35.title: 6 die in 24 hours amid heavy rains in Gujarat; death toll rises to 69
35.article_body: As many as six people died in rain-related incidents amid heavy rains in Gujarat in the last 24 hours, state Disaster Management Minister Rajendra Trivedi said. The death toll in rain-related incidents in the state since June 1 has risen to 69, he added. A 50-year-old man died after being swept off by floodwaters in Rajkot.

36.title: Pune receives 165.7 mm rainfall; Khadakwasla dam overflows
36.article_body: Pune on Tuesday received 165.7 mm of rainfall which is 26% less than normal. Khadakwasla dam overflowed and its water capacity reached 95% on Tuesday. With the prediction of more rains in the next few days, 905 cusecs water was released from new Mutha right canal and 11,900 cusecs was released from the spillway of the dam into Mutha river.

37.title: 'Oh the irony lol' tweets Elon Musk after Twitter sues him
37.article_body: Minutes after news surfaced that Twitter has sued him for breaching the $44 billion contract, Tesla CEO Elon Musk took to the microblogging site and tweeted, "Oh the irony lol". As per The Verge, the lawsuit was filed in Delaware's Court of Chancery, accusing Musk of hypocrisy. Twitter is represented by M&A law firm Wachtell, Lipton, Rosen & Katz.

38.title: Rohit breaks Afridi's world record, becomes fastest batter to reach 250 ODI sixes
38.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma on Tuesday broke former Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi's world record for being the fastest batter to reach 250 sixes in ODI cricket. Rohit took 224 innings to reach 250 sixes. Afridi had taken 259 innings to reach the milestone. Rohit slammed five sixes against England on Tuesday to complete 250 sixes in ODI cricket.

39.title: Water level in Hyderabad's Hussain Sagar lake crosses full tank level
39.article_body: Following heavy rains across Telangana, the water level in Hyderabad's Hussain Sagar lake crossed the full tank level on Tuesday. The water level was recorded at 513.44 metres against the full tank level of 513.41 metres. According to civic officials, there is no danger from Hussain Sagar, but residents living in downstream areas might be affected if the rain continues.

40.title: Sri Lankan President escapes to Maldives with his wife amid economic crisis
40.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa fled the country for the Maldives on Wednesday, hours before he was due to resign amid the economic crisis. Rajapaksa, his wife and two bodyguards left aboard a Sri Lankan Air Force plane, an immigration official told Reuters. Rajapaksa would most likely proceed to another Asian country from there, a government source said.

41.title: Shami creates history, becomes fastest Indian bowler to reach 150 wickets in ODI cricket
41.article_body: Fast bowler Mohammad Shami on Tuesday created history by becoming the fastest Indian bowler to reach 150 ODI wickets. With his three wickets in the first ODI against England, Shami took his tally of wickets in ODI cricket to 151 in 80 matches. Ajit Agarkar was the previous fastest Indian bowler to reach 150 ODI wickets, taking 97 matches.

42.title: India overtake Pakistan in latest ODI team rankings
42.article_body: India have overtaken Pakistan in the latest ICC ODI team rankings after their 10-wicket victory in the first ODI of their three-match series against England on Tuesday. India moved to the third position in the rankings with 108 rating points, leaving Pakistan behind at the fourth position with 106 points. Before the match, India were placed fourth with 105 points.

43.title: Rohit Sharma's 79-metre six hits girl in the stands, video surfaces
43.article_body: During the fifth over of India's innings against England in the first ODI, Rohit Sharma's 79-metre six went on to hit a girl in the stands. It resulted in play being halted for a short while. A video surfaced online showing a man consoling the girl. England's physio and team doctor were seen rushing towards the girl.

44.title: DMRC plans to start 3-car metro train service for 1st time in Delhi
44.article_body: Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC), for the first time, has planned to start a three-car metro train service from Narela to the Rithala section. "DMRC will have a proper metro but initially it will construct three-coach train platforms and later extend the facility to run six-coach trains in future," DMRC chief Vikas Kumar said. "These are currently proposals," he added.

45.title: Twitter sues Elon Musk for backing out of $44 billion deal
45.article_body: Twitter has sued Elon Musk for violating his $44 billion deal to buy the social media platform. "Musk apparently believes that he...is free to change his mind, trash the company...and walk away," said the lawsuit. Musk said he was terminating the deal because Twitter violated the agreement by failing to respond to requests for information regarding fake or spam accounts.

46.title: Delhi Metro to launch e-auto service for last mile connectivity
46.article_body: The Delhi Metro will soon launch its first e-auto service to boost last-mile connectivity for commuters, officials said. A batch of 50 e-vehicles will be launched from Dwarka Sector-9 station and a total of 136 autos will be present in the sub-city, DMRC chief Vikas Kumar said. Charging points and other arrangements are being made at the station.

47.title: 46-year-old man killed by speeding car in Delhi's Greater Kailash
47.article_body: A 46-year-old man was allegedly killed by a speeding car in Delhi's Greater Kailash area on Sunday, police said on Tuesday. The victim was hit by the car while he was walking and was thrown onto the pavement, police added. Police further said the victim was lying unconscious on the pavement for a long time before a passerby spotted him.

48.title: World's most powerful telescope captures 'water signature' on distant planet
48.article_body: NASA's James Webb Space Telescope has captured the distinct signature of water in the atmosphere of a distant planet orbiting a Sun-like star 1,150 light-years away. It has been captured on the giant gas planet WASP 96-b located in the Milky Way. NASA made the revelation while releasing a batch of photos taken by the world's most powerful telescope.

49.title: I think Tom Cruise is irrelevant, he's been doing the same part for 35 yrs: Mickey Rourke
49.article_body: Actor Mickey Rourke called Tom Cruise "irrelevant" and said "he has no respect" for how Tom chooses his roles. In an interview, Mickey was asked what he felt about Tom starring in 'Top Gun: Maverick', to which he replied, "That doesn't mean sh** to me...[He's]...been doing the same...part for 35 years." Mickey added he doesn't care about money and power.

50.title: Mysterious phenomenon of 'milky sea' caught on camera for first time
50.article_body: A satellite captured an image of a rare case of milky sea in the south of Indonesia, a phenomenon where the water lightens because of luminous bacteria. A team of researchers from the US confirmed a crew on a private yacht encountered the milky sea, something that is believed to appear only once or twice per year around the globe.

51.title: I am an actor because of sir: Rajkummar on mimicking SRK in college days
51.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao recalled how he would mimic actor Shah Rukh Khan when he was studying at The Film and Television Institute of India (FTII). "I used to mimic Shah Rukh Khan and Manoj Kumar, I still like...(Shah Rukh) a lot," he added. "I'm still a huge fan. Me and my friends....we still mimic Shah Rukh sir [sometimes]," Rajkummar said.

52.title: Over 5,000 civilians killed since start of war in Ukraine: UN
52.article_body: The UN human rights office (OHCHR) on Tuesday said that more than 5,000 civilians had been killed and over 6,500 others had been injured in Ukraine since the start of Russia's invasion on February 24. The real toll was likely much higher, it added. OHCHR has dozens of human rights monitors in the country.

53.title: Manipur orders closure of schools as COVID-19 cases increase
53.article_body: The Manipur government on Tuesday issued an order to close all schools in the state with immediate effect due to the sharp increase in COVID-19 cases. The schools will remain closed till July 24, 2022. This comes as 59 people in Manipur tested positive for the virus on Tuesday and the test positivity ratio crossed the 15% mark.

54.title: Bumrah was just phenomenal in 1st ODI vs England: Tendulkar
54.article_body: Following Jasprit Bumrah's 6/19 in India's 10-wicket win against England in first ODI, Sachin Tendulkar tweeted, "Great bowling performance by India's pace attack especially Bumrah who was just phenomenal." He added, "The Oval pitch has great bounce but Indian bowlers bowled...right lengths." Notably, Bumrah became the first Indian pacer to take six wickets in an ODI in England on Tuesday.

55.title: Opting to bowl first was a right call: Rohit on India's 10-wicket win
55.article_body: After India defeated England by 10 wickets in first ODI at The Oval, captain Rohit Sharma said opting to bowl first after winning the toss was a right call to make by looking at overhead conditions and the pitch. "There was some swing...seam upfront and we exploited them well," he added. India bundled out England for 110 in 25.2 overs.

56.title: Country does not need a silent President: Yashwant Sinha
56.article_body: Presidential election candidate Yashwant Sinha said that the country does not need a silent president but rather someone who uses moral authority and discretion. Yashwant Sinha is the opposition candidate for the upcoming Presidential polls. Sinha accused the ruling party of misusing central agencies like the CBI against political rivals and said he will stop such acts if elected.

57.title: CBI chargesheet meets requirements: Court on denying Deshmukh's bail
57.article_body: While refusing default bail to ex-Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh in a corruption case, a court stated that CBI's chargesheet against him met all requirements. Deshmukh had sought bail over claims that the chargesheet hadn't been submitted within the 60-day mandated period and that the chargesheet was incomplete. Courts cannot be too technical while entertaining bail pleas, the court said.

58.title: SAD's youth wing to take out tractor march against ban on 2 songs
58.article_body: Shiromani Akali Dal's (SAD) youth wing Youth Akali Dal has announced that it'll take out a tractor march on Thursday in protest against the Centre's ban on two Punjabi Songs. YAD president Parambans Romana said SAD views the Centre's ban on 'SYL' by late Sidhu Moosewala and 'Rihai' by Kanwar Grewal as an attempt to suppress the voice of Punjabis.

59.title: I stay out of VC ecosystem as I don't believe in it: Zoho Co-founder
59.article_body: Zoho Co-founder and CEO Sridhar Vembu has said that he doesn't believe in the venture capital (VC) ecosystem. "I stay out of the VC ecosystem because I fundamentally don't believe in it. The thing I see (with VC-funded companies) is that it's all too exit-focused," he said. Notably, Zoho has never raised any VC funding to date.

60.title: Lightspeed raises new $500 mn fund for India, Southeast Asia
60.article_body: Lightspeed Venture Partners, a Silicon-valley headquartered firm, has announced the closure of its $500 million fund dedicated to India and Southeast Asia. Lightspeed has invested in OYO, Udaan, BYJU'S, Razorpay, and ShareChat and looks to further invest in early-stage startups. The new fund comes from a $7 billion capital that the VC firm has raised to invest in startups globally.

61.title: Miscreants attack Punjab Advocate General in train near Panipat
61.article_body: Unidentified miscreants attacked Punjab Advocate General Anmol Rattan Sidhu while he was travelling on a Shatabdi train from Delhi to Chandigarh on Tuesday. The assailants allegedly pelted stones at Sidhu's bogie, breaking the windowpane of his compartment after the train crossed Haryana's Panipat. Notably, Sidhu had appeared in the Supreme Court on Monday in relation to the Lawrence Bishnoi case.

62.title: J&K sets up transgender welfare board to protect their rights
62.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir administration has announced that they have set up a transgender welfare board for the protection of the rights of the minority population. The total population of transgenders in Jammu and Kashmir was 4,137 as per the 2011 census. The Chief Secretary will be the head of the 13-member welfare board, an official order stated.

63.title: Activist & Padma Shri awardee Avdhash Kaushal passes away at 84
63.article_body: Social activist and Padma Shri awardee Avdhash Kaushal passed away at 84 on Tuesday following a prolonged illness. Kaushal died at a private hospital in Dehradun. He headed the Rural Litigation and Entitlement Kendra NGO which was focused on development work amongst tribal communities in the Dehradun district. He founded the NGO in the late 1970s.

64.title: Karti Chidambaram's bail plea hearing adjourned till August 18
64.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Tuesday adjourned the hearing on the anticipatory bail plea of Congress leader Karti Chidambaram till August 18. Justice Poonam A Bamba adjourned the matter since Additional Solicitor General SV Raju was unavailable. Karti is seeking anticipatory bail in a money laundering case related to the Chinese visa scam.

65.title: K'taka bus cleaner dies, his parents praised for donating organs
65.article_body: A 24-year-old bus cleaner from Karnataka has passed away after being critically injured in a road accident last week. The state's Health Minister Dr K Sudhakar praised the man's parents for their generosity as they have donated the deceased's organs. "[Naveen Kumar's] liver, kidney, heart valve and retina have been transplanted and will give life to others," the minister tweeted.

66.title: 65-yr-old cheating accused jumps off court building in Surat, dies
66.article_body: Police said that a 65-year-old man, Bharat Italia, who was accused in a cheating case, jumped to death from the second floor of a court building in Gujarat's Surat on Tuesday. While being escorted back from the court, the accused suddenly escaped and jumped from the building, a police official said. Italia was taken to a hospital where he died.

67.title: Situation in Sri Lanka is very sensitive & complicated: Jaishankar
67.article_body: Replying to a media query, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Tuesday said, "The situation in Sri Lanka is very sensitive, it's very complicated. Even as we speak many developments are taking place." India has been extremely supportive of Sri Lankans in the last few months, he added. Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa is due to step down tomorrow.

68.title: NIA court extends police remand of 3 accused in Udaipur murder case
68.article_body: An NIA court on Tuesday extended the police custody of three of the accused in the Udaipur murder case till Saturday. The remaining four accused have been sent to judicial custody. The men remanded to NIA custody include Riaz Akhtari and Ghouse Mohammad, who killed Udaipur tailor Kanhaiya Lal in June for avenging an alleged insult to Islam.

69.title: Iran arrests 3 filmmakers in less than 1 week amid govt crackdown
69.article_body: Iran has arrested prominent filmmaker Jafar Panahi, the third arrest in less than a week amid a crackdown by the government, reports stated on Tuesday. Panahi had reportedly gone to the prosecutor's office to check on his colleagues, who were detained recently when he was also imprisoned. Panahi has been reportedly sent to jail to serve a previous prison term.

70.title: Venezuelan refugee women face rising violence in Colombia, Peru: Report
70.article_body: Amnesty International in a report on Tuesday said that Venezuelan refugee women face rising gender-based violence in Peru and Colombia. Gender-based violence against Venezuelan women in Colombia increased by 71% between 2018 and 2021, and in Peru by 31% between 2019 and 2021, official government data showed. Over 60 lakh people have fled Venezuela amid an economic crisis.

71.title: IndiGo starts disciplinary proceedings after mass sick leaves: Report
71.article_body: IndiGo has started disciplinary proceedings against aeroplane maintenance technicians who went on mass sick leave for five days, PTI reported. The airline has asked concerned technicians to come in and see the airline doctor along with any appropriate medical records so the company can confirm they were genuinely ill, the report said. The technicians took leave to protest inadequate pay.

72.title: Hotel industry revenues to return to pre-COVID levels in FY23: ICRA
72.article_body: The hotel industry's revenues and margins are expected to return to pre-COVID levels in FY23, ratings agency ICRA said. Demand will be mainly driven by domestic leisure and transient travel, although there will be a gradual recovery in business travel and foreign tourist arrivals, ICRA said. Pan-India premium hotel occupancy is expected to be at 68-70% for FY23, it added.

73.title: NIA court extends police remand of 3 accused in Udaipur murder case
73.article_body: An NIA court on Tuesday extended the police custody of three of the accused in the Udaipur murder case till Saturday. The remaining four accused have been sent to judicial custody. The men remanded to NIA custody include Riaz Akhtari and Ghouse Mohammad, who killed Udaipur tailor Kanhaiya Lal in June for avenging an alleged insult to Islam.

74.title: Miscreants attack Punjab Advocate General in train near Panipat
74.article_body: Unidentified miscreants attacked Punjab Advocate General Anmol Rattan Sidhu while he was travelling on a Shatabdi train from Delhi to Chandigarh on Tuesday. The assailants allegedly pelted stones at Sidhu's bogie, breaking the windowpane of his compartment after the train crossed Haryana's Panipat. Notably, Sidhu had appeared in the Supreme Court on Monday in relation to the Lawrence Bishnoi case.

75.title: SAD's youth wing to take out tractor march against ban on 2 songs
75.article_body: Shiromani Akali Dal's (SAD) youth wing Youth Akali Dal has announced that it'll take out a tractor march on Thursday in protest against the Centre's ban on two Punjabi Songs. YAD president Parambans Romana said SAD views the Centre's ban on 'SYL' by late Sidhu Moosewala and 'Rihai' by Kanwar Grewal as an attempt to suppress the voice of Punjabis.

76.title: Country does not need a silent President: Yashwant Sinha
76.article_body: Presidential election candidate Yashwant Sinha said that the country does not need a silent president but rather someone who uses moral authority and discretion. Yashwant Sinha is the opposition candidate for the upcoming Presidential polls. Sinha accused the ruling party of misusing central agencies like the CBI against political rivals and said he will stop such acts if elected.

77.title: Venezuelan refugee women face rising violence in Colombia, Peru: Report
77.article_body: Amnesty International in a report on Tuesday said that Venezuelan refugee women face rising gender-based violence in Peru and Colombia. Gender-based violence against Venezuelan women in Colombia increased by 71% between 2018 and 2021, and in Peru by 31% between 2019 and 2021, official government data showed. Over 60 lakh people have fled Venezuela amid an economic crisis.

78.title: Opting to bowl first was a right call: Rohit on India's 10-wicket win
78.article_body: After India defeated England by 10 wickets in first ODI at The Oval, captain Rohit Sharma said opting to bowl first after winning the toss was a right call to make by looking at overhead conditions and the pitch. "There was some swing...seam upfront and we exploited them well," he added. India bundled out England for 110 in 25.2 overs.

79.title: J&K sets up transgender welfare board to protect their rights
79.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir administration has announced that they have set up a transgender welfare board for the protection of the rights of the minority population. The total population of transgenders in Jammu and Kashmir was 4,137 as per the 2011 census. The Chief Secretary will be the head of the 13-member welfare board, an official order stated.

80.title: World's most powerful telescope captures 'water signature' on distant planet
80.article_body: NASA's James Webb Space Telescope has captured the distinct signature of water in the atmosphere of a distant planet orbiting a Sun-like star 1,150 light-years away. It has been captured on the giant gas planet WASP 96-b located in the Milky Way. NASA made the revelation while releasing a batch of photos taken by the world's most powerful telescope.

81.title: Bumrah was just phenomenal in 1st ODI vs England: Tendulkar
81.article_body: Following Jasprit Bumrah's 6/19 in India's 10-wicket win against England in first ODI, Sachin Tendulkar tweeted, "Great bowling performance by India's pace attack especially Bumrah who was just phenomenal." He added, "The Oval pitch has great bounce but Indian bowlers bowled...right lengths." Notably, Bumrah became the first Indian pacer to take six wickets in an ODI in England on Tuesday.

82.title: CBI chargesheet meets requirements: Court on denying Deshmukh's bail
82.article_body: While refusing default bail to ex-Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh in a corruption case, a court stated that CBI's chargesheet against him met all requirements. Deshmukh had sought bail over claims that the chargesheet hadn't been submitted within the 60-day mandated period and that the chargesheet was incomplete. Courts cannot be too technical while entertaining bail pleas, the court said.

83.title: Manipur orders closure of schools as COVID-19 cases increase
83.article_body: The Manipur government on Tuesday issued an order to close all schools in the state with immediate effect due to the sharp increase in COVID-19 cases. The schools will remain closed till July 24, 2022. This comes as 59 people in Manipur tested positive for the virus on Tuesday and the test positivity ratio crossed the 15% mark.

84.title: Lightspeed raises new $500 mn fund for India, Southeast Asia
84.article_body: Lightspeed Venture Partners, a Silicon-valley headquartered firm, has announced the closure of its $500 million fund dedicated to India and Southeast Asia. Lightspeed has invested in OYO, Udaan, BYJU'S, Razorpay, and ShareChat and looks to further invest in early-stage startups. The new fund comes from a $7 billion capital that the VC firm has raised to invest in startups globally.

85.title: K'taka bus cleaner dies; minister praises parents for donating organs
85.article_body: A 24-year-old bus cleaner from Karnataka has passed away after being critically injured in a road accident last week. The state's Health Minister Dr K Sudhakar praised the man's parents for their generosity as they have donated the deceased's organs. "[Naveen Kumar's] liver, kidney, heart valve and retina have been transplanted and will give life to others," the minister tweeted.

86.title: Situation in Sri Lanka is very sensitive & complicated: Jaishankar
86.article_body: Replying to a media query, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Tuesday said, "The situation in Sri Lanka is very sensitive, it's very complicated. Even as we speak many developments are taking place." India has been extremely supportive of Sri Lankans in the last few months, he added. Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa is due to step down tomorrow.

87.title: I am an actor because of sir: Rajkummar on mimicking SRK in college days
87.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao recalled how he would mimic actor Shah Rukh Khan when he was studying at The Film and Television Institute of India (FTII). "I used to mimic Shah Rukh Khan and Manoj Kumar, I still like...(Shah Rukh) a lot," he added. "I'm still a huge fan. Me and my friends....we still mimic Shah Rukh sir [sometimes]," Rajkummar said.

88.title: IndiGo starts disciplinary proceedings after mass sick leaves: Report
88.article_body: IndiGo has started disciplinary proceedings against aeroplane maintenance technicians who went on mass sick leave for five days, PTI reported. The airline has asked concerned technicians to come in and see the airline doctor along with any appropriate medical records so the company can confirm they were genuinely ill, the report said. The technicians took leave to protest inadequate pay.

89.title: Hotel industry revenues to return to pre-COVID levels in FY23: ICRA
89.article_body: The hotel industry's revenues and margins are expected to return to pre-COVID levels in FY23, ratings agency ICRA said. Demand will be mainly driven by domestic leisure and transient travel, although there will be a gradual recovery in business travel and foreign tourist arrivals, ICRA said. Pan-India premium hotel occupancy is expected to be at 68-70% for FY23, it added.

90.title: Mysterious phenomenon of 'milky sea' caught on camera for first time
90.article_body: A satellite captured an image of a rare case of milky sea in the south of Indonesia, a phenomenon where the water lightens because of luminous bacteria. A team of researchers from the US confirmed a crew on a private yacht encountered the milky sea, something that is believed to appear only once or twice per year around the globe.

91.title: Over 5,000 civilians killed since start of war in Ukraine: UN
91.article_body: The UN human rights office (OHCHR) on Tuesday said that more than 5,000 civilians had been killed and over 6,500 others had been injured in Ukraine since the start of Russia's invasion on February 24. The real toll was likely much higher, it added. OHCHR has dozens of human rights monitors in the country.

92.title: Activist & Padma Shri awardee Avdhash Kaushal passes away at 84
92.article_body: Social activist and Padma Shri awardee Avdhash Kaushal passed away at 84 on Tuesday following a prolonged illness. Kaushal died at a private hospital in Dehradun. He headed the Rural Litigation and Entitlement Kendra NGO which was focused on development work amongst tribal communities in the Dehradun district. He founded the NGO in the late 1970s.

93.title: Karti Chidambaram's bail plea hearing adjourned till August 18
93.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Tuesday adjourned the hearing on the anticipatory bail plea of Congress leader Karti Chidambaram till August 18. Justice Poonam A Bamba adjourned the matter since Additional Solicitor General SV Raju was unavailable. Karti is seeking anticipatory bail in a money laundering case related to the Chinese visa scam.

94.title: Iran arrests 3 filmmakers in less than 1 week amid govt crackdown
94.article_body: Iran has arrested prominent filmmaker Jafar Panahi, the third arrest in less than a week amid a crackdown by the government, reports stated on Tuesday. Panahi had reportedly gone to the prosecutor's office to check on his colleagues, who were detained recently when he was also imprisoned. Panahi has been reportedly sent to jail to serve a previous prison term.

95.title: I think Tom Cruise is irrelevant, he's been doing the same part for 35 yrs: Mickey Rourke
95.article_body: Actor Mickey Rourke called Tom Cruise "irrelevant" and said "he has no respect" for how Tom chooses his roles. In an interview, Mickey was asked what he felt about Tom starring in 'Top Gun: Maverick', to which he replied, "That doesn't mean sh** to me...[He's]...been doing the same...part for 35 years." Mickey added he doesn't care about money and power.

96.title: I stay out of VC ecosystem as I don't believe in it: Zoho Co-founder
96.article_body: Zoho Co-founder and CEO Sridhar Vembu has said that he doesn't believe in the venture capital (VC) ecosystem. "I stay out of the VC ecosystem because I fundamentally don't believe in it. The thing I see (with VC-funded companies) is that it's all too exit-focused," he said. Notably, Zoho has never raised any VC funding to date.

97.title: 65-yr-old cheating accused jumps off court building in Surat, dies
97.article_body: Police said that a 65-year-old man, Bharat Italia, who was accused in a cheating case, jumped to death from the second floor of a court building in Gujarat's Surat on Tuesday. While being escorted back from the court, the accused suddenly escaped and jumped from the building, a police official said. Italia was taken to a hospital where he died.

98.title: Croatia to become 20th country to adopt euro as currency
98.article_body: European Union (EU) on Tuesday formally approved Croatia's accession to the eurozone, paving the way for the Balkan nation to adopt euro as its currency from January 1, 2023. This confirms that the euro remained an "attractive, resilient and successful global currency", European Commission Vice President Valdis Dombrovskis said. "It's a big day for Croatia," the Croatian Finance Minister said.

99.title: 1st batch of full-colour images taken from world's most powerful space telescope released
99.article_body: NASA on Tuesday released new full-colour images taken from James Webb Space Telescope, the world's most powerful space telescope. It released images of Southern Ring planetary nebula, showing a dying star cloaked by dust and layers of light. Another image shows Stephan's Quintet, a visual grouping of five galaxies. An image revealing baby stars in Carina Nebula was also released.

100.title: Drug peddler's properties worth ₹83.2 lakh attached in Haryana
100.article_body: The properties of a drug peddler, Gurmez Singh alias Gurmail, were attached and his assets were frozen in Haryana's Kaithal district on Tuesday. Police said Singh had purchased properties worth ₹83.22 lakh from the proceeds of drug peddling. "On the request of Haryana Police, a competent authority in New Delhi, passed orders to freeze movable and immovable assets," police said.

101.title: ODI or Test cricket, no better pair in world cricket: Sehwag on Bumrah, Shami
101.article_body: Praising Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammad Shami following their bowling performances in the first ODI against England, Virender Sehwag said, "One day cricket or Test cricket, no better pair in world cricket. Bumrah and Shami are a class apart." Bumrah posted bowling figures of 7.2-3-19-6, while Shami registered 7-0-31-3. India defeated England by 10 wickets at The Oval.

102.title: Assam govt appoints 280 specially-abled candidates as teachers
102.article_body: Assam government on Tuesday distributed appointment letters to 280 specially-abled candidates for the post of teachers across different schools in various districts of the state. The letters were distributed by Assam Education Minister Dr Ranoj Pegu during a programme held in Guwahati. As many as 193 candidates were appointed in lower primary schools and the rest in upper primary schools.

103.title: New images of the universe taken from world's most powerful space telescope released
103.article_body: NASA on Tuesday released new images taken from James Webb Space Telescope, the world's most powerful space telescope. It released images of the Southern Ring planetary nebula, showing a dying star cloaked by dust and layers of light. Another image shows Stephan's Quintet, a visual grouping of five galaxies. An image revealing baby stars in Carina Nebula was also released.

104.title: Staff misbehaved, made racist remarks: Khali on allegedly slapping toll staffer
104.article_body: After a Punjab toll staff accused former WWE wrestler Dalip Singh Rana aka The Great Khali of slapping one of the employees, the latter said the staffer had stopped his car and "misbehaved for a selfie". "When I denied the selfie, they ruthlessly passed racist comments and used bad words," said Khali. A video of the argument earlier went viral.

105.title: Coronavirus pandemic is nowhere near over: WHO chief
105.article_body: World Health Organization (WHO) Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus on Tuesday said, "COVID-19 is nowhere near over." "As the virus pushes at us, we must push back," he added. WHO's Emergency Committee, made up of independent experts, said rising cases, ongoing viral evolution and pressure on health services in a number of countries meant that the situation was still an emergency.

106.title: Bless and support me: Droupadi Murmu to YSRCP leaders in Andhra
106.article_body: NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu met YSRCP leaders in Andhra Pradesh's Amaravati on Tuesday as part of her election campaign and requested them to bless and support her. "Andhra and Odisha are neighbours and have many similarities in food habits, dress and customs," Murmu said. "I thank Jagan Mohan Reddy for extending support even before I requested," she added.

107.title: It'll take 89m plus to win in Eugene: Neeraj ahead of World Athletics C'ships
107.article_body: Ahead of World Athletics Championships 2022, reigning Olympic gold medallist javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra said there is no pressure. "I train well and give [my] 100% in competition," he added. Neeraj, who threw a personal best of 89.94 metres at Stockholm Diamond League last month said, "I'm close to 90 metres...it'll take 89 metres plus to win in Eugene."

108.title: Jharkhand will become leading state if Centre's support continues: CM
108.article_body: Jharkhand Chief Minister Hemant Soren on Tuesday said that the state would be one of the leading states in the next five to seven years if support from the Centre continued. "Jharkhand has been contributing to nation building for years through its minerals, including coal and iron," Soren said, reminding that the state's contribution should not be forgotten.

109.title: Drone startups raise $87 mn since new govt rules in 2021
109.article_body: After the change in rules for the drone sector in August 2021, the industry has seen a funding boost of $87 million in the last year, according market researcher Venture Intelligence's data. As more sectors use drones, 10 startups received funding, double from last year. Companies such as ideaForge raised $20 million, and The ePlane Company raised $5 million.

110.title: Rajkummar, Sanya host screening of 'HIT: The First Case' for Delhi Police
110.article_body: Actors Rajkummar Rao and Sanya Malhotra along with director Sailesh Kolanu hosted a special screening of their upcoming film 'HIT: The First Case' for Delhi Police on Monday. Actress Huma Qureshi also attended the screening. Delhi Police officials were extremely happy with the film's story and appreciated it for showcasing the real investigative police world, reported Free Press Journal.

111.title: Sonali revisits hospital where she underwent cancer treatment, says 'Was unreal'
111.article_body: Actress Sonali Bendre shared a video on her Instagram handle, recalling her cancer journey as she revisited the same hospital where she underwent cancer treatment. Sharing the video, she wrote, "Four years later, from sheer terror to continued hope, so much has changed yet so much remains the same. It was unreal...I felt like telling the patients that there's hope."

112.title: 5,000 Delhi govt school kids given free CUET coaching classes: Sisodia
112.article_body: Delhi's Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia revealed that over 5,000 Delhi government school students were provided free preparatory classes for Common University Entrance Test (CUET). Many students couldn't afford high coaching fees, he said, adding, "The initiative ensured that [they] don't consider giving up dreams because of financial reasons." The students were guided in over 13 subjects.

113.title: Govt cracks down on industrial usage of urea intended for farmers
113.article_body: The Chemicals and Fertilizers Ministry has launched a nationwide crackdown to curb the use of agricultural-grade urea by industries. The ministry also launched a flying squad for taking strict action against this. According to an official, the diversion causes subsidy leakage worth ₹6,000 crore while leakages worth ₹100 crore were identified in the last 2.5 months.

114.title: German auto components firm Bosch to invest over ₹200 crore in India
114.article_body: German auto components firm Bosch will invest ₹200 crore in India over next five years in advanced automotive technologies and digital mobility space, Managing Director Soumitra Bhattacharya said. The company is also "quietly and cautiously" optimistic about having double-digit growth in FY2022-23 over the previous fiscal, he added. In 2021-22, Bosch recorded a profit after tax of ₹1,217 crore.

115.title: CBI may question senior journalist in NSE phone tapping case: Report
115.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) is likely to question a senior journalist in Mumbai in connection with the alleged phone tapping of National Stock Exchange (NSE) employees, Moneycontrol reported. CBI found the journalist had introduced former Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey to former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna. Pandey is also being probed in the matter.

116.title: I will only make 'Thor 5' with Chris Hemsworth: Taika Waititi
116.article_body: Filmmaker Taika Waititi has stated that he will only make another 'Thor' film if actor Chris Hemsworth is a part of it. "But it would need to be something surprising and unexpected for me to want to do it...The battles and...the fighting is fine, but I would want something that feels unexpected when it comes to the story," he added.

117.title: Nothing is planned yet: Suniel on rumours of Athiya, Rahul getting married
117.article_body: Suniel Shetty reacted to the reports that his daughter, Athiya Shetty, and cricketer KL Rahul are getting married in the next three months. Dismissing the rumours, Suniel said, "Nothing has been planned yet." A report in a news portal suggested that the couple has apparently bought a place together and will move into their new house after tying the knot.

118.title: CUET will be conducted in 2 phases starting July 15: UGC
118.article_body: The Common University Entrance Test (CUET) for admission to UG courses will be conducted in two phases starting from July 15, University Grants Commission (UGC) Chairman M Jagadesh Kumar said. The examinations will end on August 20. The admit cards for the first phase were issued today. "We're issuing admit cards just four days before...examinations...to ensure good security," Kumar said.

119.title: Never seen such shameless misuse of central agencies: Sinha
119.article_body: Opposition candidate for Presidential polls Yashwant Sinha on Tuesday criticised the Central government and said that he's never seen such blatant, shameless misuse of central agencies to fix rivals. He said that elections for the post of President are taking place in troubled conditions, adding that democracy is in grave danger. The economy is badly mismanaged, he added.

120.title: Fintech startup Hesa to financially empower 60,000 rural merchants
120.article_body: Hyderabad-based agri-fintech startup Hesa announced that it's aiming to provide financial solutions to 60,000 rural entrepreneurs including farmers across 30,000 villages in Telangana. Through this programme, Hesa will offer ease of transactions such as bill payments, opening an account, withdrawing money, among others. It aims to reduce the financial challenges faced by the rural population.

121.title: BJP is a 'control-freak', 'dossier-loving' government: Congress MP
121.article_body: Congress MP Abhishek Singhvi on Tuesday accused the BJP of being a "control freak" and "dossier loving" government. Singhvi further said the BJP government has created an atmosphere of "fear, trepidation, anxiety and hesitation" among the judicial sector by the misuse of the "dossier raj". "BJP has indulged in several manipulative tactics qua the judiciary," Singhvi added.

122.title: SC upholds life terms for 4 convicts for plotting terror attacks
122.article_body: The Supreme Court has upheld the life sentence awarded to four people for plotting terror attacks in India. The convicts, guilty of having links with Lashkar-e-Taiba, were arrested during investigations of the 2005 attack at Bangalore's Indian Institute of Science. The convicts had moved the Supreme Court after the Karnataka High Court increased their seven-year sentence to life term.

123.title: India defeat England by 10 wickets in an ODI for the first time in history
123.article_body: India chased down a 111-run target against England in 18.4 overs without losing a wicket to win the first ODI at London's Kennington Oval. It's the first time in ODI cricket history that India defeated England by a margin of 10 wickets. England were bowled out for 110 runs in the match, which is their lowest ODI total against India.

124.title: Was rejected for my eyebrows, I was like 'What about acting?': Rajkummar
124.article_body: When asked about his early days and the kind of rejections he faced, Rajkummar Rao said, "I was told so many things. You're not tall enough, your build is not right, your eyebrows are a little…not in a certain shape." "[I heard] very weird things. I was like ‘What? What about acting?’ Voh kisko chahiye? (Who wants that?)" he added.

125.title: Audience is now used to consuming content at home: Naga Chaitanya
125.article_body: Actor Naga Chaitanya stated that the priority of the audience has shifted now, adding that they have become used to the idea of consuming content at home. He added that he chooses scripts based on this. "They are not putting down the film or insulting it in any way. It's just...how they have evolved post the pandemic," the actor said.

126.title: Can't take my eyes off this performance: Bhogle on Bumrah's 6/19 at The Oval
126.article_body: Commentator Harsha Bhogle took to Twitter to praise India pacer Jasprit Bumrah following his 6/19 in the first ODI against England at The Oval. "What a spell! Can't take my eyes off this performance by Bumrah," he wrote. Wasim Jaffer tweeted, "Alexa, please play Bumrah. Sorry, Bumrah is unplayable." England were bowled out for 110 in 25.2 overs.

127.title: Around 60 startups have registered with ISRO: MoS Jitendra Singh
127.article_body: Minister of State for Science, Technology and Space Jitendra Singh said that around 60 startups have registered with ISRO since PM Narendra Modi "unlocked" the space sector. He added that while a few startups are dealing with space debris management, proposals have also been received for other services. He also lauded the PM for allowing private players in space sector.

128.title: Russian journalist fined ₹1.6 lakh under 'gay propaganda' law
128.article_body: A Russian journalist was fined 120,000 roubles (₹1.6 lakh) by a Moscow court on Tuesday under law that prohibits "propaganda" in support of gay relationships. Yury Dud, who has notably also denounced Russian invasion of Ukraine, was fined due to interview he conducted with a homosexual artist, lawyer said. Russia criminalised "propagandising" non-traditional sexual orientations to minors in 2013.

129.title: Kichcha Sudeepa pays school fees of two students in Bengaluru
129.article_body: Actor-singer Kichcha Sudeepa has assisted two students in their education by paying their school fees. The students, who attend Chamarajpet Ram Mandir school in Bengaluru, were unable to go to school because of financial issues. Earlier, he had adopted a government school in his home town Shivamogga in Karnataka which is said to be around 133 years old.

130.title: Govt will raise funds from capital market for road projects: Gadkari
130.article_body: Union Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari said on Tuesday that the government will raise funds from capital markets for road projects. "I don't want to use the finances of rich people. I'm going to share market, and...I'm going to take investments from small people," he said. The construction equipment industry is facing problems due to rising crude oil prices, he added.

131.title: I am naturally disappointed: Vijay Mallya on 4-month jail sentence
131.article_body: Fugitive businessman Vijay Mallya said he was "naturally disappointed" at the Supreme Court verdict sentencing him to four months in jail in a 2017 contempt of court case. Mallya was convicted of contempt in 2017 for transferring $40 million to his children in violation of court orders. The apex court also imposed a fine of ₹2,000 on him.

132.title: First made-in-India qHPV vaccine against cervical cancer in women gets DCGI's approval
132.article_body: The DCGI granted market authorisation to Serum Institute of India (SII) to manufacture indigenously-developed India's first Quadrivalent Human Papillomavirus vaccine (qHPV) against cervical cancer in women. Saying the vaccine will be "affordable and accessible", SII CEO Adar Poonawalla said, "We look forward to launching it later this year and we thank...DCGI @MoHFW_INDIA for granting approval."

133.title: It was a good learning: Suryakumar on his 117 in India's 17-run loss
133.article_body: India batter Suryakumar Yadav, who scored his maiden T20I century(117) in third T20I against England, said he's happy with the way things went in Nottingham. "At the same time I felt that there was a slight opportunity to take the team past the line. It happens, it was a learning process," he added. India lost the match by 17 runs.

134.title: I was approached for 'Aarya' but it didn't work for me: Kajol Devgan
134.article_body: Kajol Devgan said she was approached for 'Aarya'. When asked if she has watched the show, Kajol said, "I did…I liked the script very much. But it didn’t work out for me...at that time." ''Was it due to date issues? There were other reasons for it," she added. The series was later remade with Sushmita Sen as the titular character.

135.title: 3 Kerala men found guilty of recruiting youngsters to Islamic State
135.article_body: A National Investigation Agency (NIA) court has found three men from Kerala guilty of recruiting youngsters to the Islamic State with the intention of waging a war against India. Earlier, the NIA found that one of the accused, 60-year-old UK Hamsa, acted as a propagandist of the IS ideology in Kerala and helped radicalise around 20 youngsters.

136.title: ASI martyred, 2 policemen injured as terrorists open fire in J&K
136.article_body: An Assistant Sub-Inspector (ASI) was martyred and two other police personnel sustained injuries after terrorists open fired upon a police party in the Lal Bazar area of Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar on Tuesday. The injured personnel have been shifted to a hospital. Police said the area has been cordoned off to track down the attackers, who managed to escape.

137.title: Rahul leaves for personal visit abroad, to skip key Congress meeting
137.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi left for a personal visit overseas on Tuesday, the party confirmed, but didn't disclose any details about the visit. Rahul will skip a crucial Congress meeting on July 14 to discuss the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' and internal party elections. All senior Congress members, including general secretaries, in-charges and PCC presidents, have been invited to the meeting.

138.title: Side-by-side pics show how powerful James Webb Space Telescope is compared to Hubble
138.article_body: Hours after the first image captured by the James Webb Space Telescope was released, Twitter users shared photos comparing the new telescope with its predecessor Hubble. Many users posted side-by-side images to show the difference between them. While the images taken by James Webb telescope are sharper, those captured by Hubble appear to lack in details.

139.title: Jharkhand to get airports in Bokaro, Jamshedpur & Dumka: Scindia
139.article_body: Union Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia on Tuesday said that Jharkhand will get three more airports, taking the total number of airports in the state to five. The new airports will be built in Bokaro, Jamshedpur and Dumka, he added. Scindia also said that 14 new air routes will be made available in the state to increase connectivity.

140.title: I cut off from people after divorce with Karan Singh Grover: Jennifer Winget
140.article_body: Actress Jennifer Winget has revealed that she cut off from people after her divorce with actor Karan Singh Grover. She said, "I used to see people looking at me with those sad, sympathetic eyes like, 'Arrey bechari yaar,' and that used to piss me off more." Jennifer and Karan got married in 2012 and separated in 2014.

141.title: BRO reconstructs bridge destroyed by flash flood in Arunachal in 7 days
141.article_body: The Border Roads Organisation (BRO) has reconstructed a strategic bridge in Kurung Kumey district of Arunachal Pradesh in seven days. The Bailey Bridge on Koloriang-Lee-Huri road in the district was destroyed in a major flash flood earlier this month. The reconstruction was a challenging task posed by tough circumstances including incessant rains and landslides, a senior official said.

142.title: Tough for Bhuvneshwar to get in India XI for T20 WC with Bumrah, Shami: Gough
142.article_body: Ex-England pacer Darren Gough said it will be difficult for Bhuvneshwar Kumar to get in the T20 World Cup playing XI with Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammad Shami already in the side and with youngsters who are coming through having terrific pace. He added that with Bhuvneshwar's swing bowling skills he will be a massive player for India in Australia.

143.title: Shortcut politics can destroy the nation: PM Modi in Deoghar
143.article_body: Addressing a rally in Jharkhand's Deoghar, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday said that shortcut politics based on populist measures can destroy the nation. "If the politics of one country depends on shortcut politics, then it will lead to a short circuit," PM Modi said. "Those who do politics of shortcut will never build new airports, modern highways," he added.

144.title: 2 killed, 4 injured in a road accident in Assam's Dhemaji
144.article_body: Police said that two persons were killed and four others were critically injured when the vehicle in which they were travelling hit the railing of a damaged bridge in Assam's Dhemaji district on Tuesday. The driver of the vehicle, carrying eight passengers from Arunachal Pradesh's Pasighat to Assam's Silapathar lost control, killing two persons on the spot, police added.

145.title: Over 60 killed in Pak's Balochistan in rain-related incidents
145.article_body: As many as 62 people, including 24 children, have lost their lives in Pakistan's Balochistan due to rain-related incidents, officials said. Torrential rains in the region have reportedly destroyed more than 670 houses and injured about 50 people. Separately, the Pakistan Meteorological Department (PMD) has predicted "heavy to very heavy" rains in Karachi from July 14 to July 17.

146.title: Sara says she wants to date Vijay Deverakonda on 'Koffee...', actor reacts
146.article_body: The new promo of celebrity talk show 'Koffee With Karan' shows actress Sara Ali Khan saying that she wants to date Telugu actor Vijay Deverakonda. Vijay shared a video of the promo on Instagram Stories, writing, "I love how you say 'Deverakonda'. Cutest. Sending big hugs and my affection." Sara will appear on the show with actress Janhvi Kapoor.

147.title: I think I'm more Nadal than I am Federer: Golfer Mcllroy
147.article_body: Golfer Rory Mcllroy said he's more like Rafael Nadal than Roger Federer. "But I'm not. I just don't have his [Nadal] grit and will," he added. Mcllroy further said that he still loves playing golf like 40-year-old Federer still loves playing tennis after having an unbelievably successful and long career. Federer has won 20 Grand Slams and Nadal 22.

148.title: 4 of family, including 2 children, die of electrocution in T'gana
148.article_body: Police said four members of a family, including two children, died due to electrocution in Telangana's Kamareddy on Tuesday. The incident took place when a live wire running from a pole to their house fell on them due to incessant rains, killing 35-year-old Ahmed, 30-year-old Parveen, six-year-old Maheen and four-year-old Adnan. A case was registered under Section 174 of CrPC.

149.title: US airstrike kills leader of Islamic State in Syria
149.article_body: Maher al-Agal, one of the top five ISIS leaders and the leader of ISIS in Syria, has been killed in a US air strike, the US military said on Tuesday. A senior ISIS official closely associated with Maher was seriously injured during the strike. "An initial review indicates there were no civilian casualties," the statement added.

150.title: England record their lowest-ever total against India in ODI cricket
150.article_body: England were dismissed for 110 runs in 25.2 overs against India in the first ODI at London's Kennington Oval. It is England's lowest-ever total against India in ODI cricket. As many as four England batters were dismissed without scoring a run in the match. England's previous lowest ODI total against India was 125, registered on October 15, 2006 in Jaipur.

151.title: Bumrah records best-ever ODI bowling figures by an Indian outside Asia
151.article_body: Team India fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah has set the record for registering the best-ever bowling figures in an ODI by an Indian bowler outside Asia. The 28-year-old registered figures of 7.2-3-19-6 against England in the first ODI at The Oval to set the record. The previous record was held by Kuldeep Yadav, who had recorded 10-0-25-6 against England in Nottingham.

152.title: Thailand to offer chemical castration to sex offenders in return for shorter jail term
152.article_body: Thailand is close to enacting a law allowing voluntary chemical castration of sex offenders. A Bill has been passed by the Thai Senate that will enable authorities to offer chemical castration to sex criminals in return to have their prison sentences shortened. Convicts will be offered injections to reduce their testosterone levels as part of the castration treatment.

153.title: Bajrang Dal worker assaulted by 5 men in Karnataka, 2 arrested
153.article_body: A Bajrang Dal worker named Kantharaj has alleged that five men assaulted him in Karnataka's Shivamogga on Monday night. In a police complaint, Kantharaj claimed the men had ambushed him outside his house. In an interview with Times Now, he said he was attacked only because of his connection to the Bajrang Dal. Two of the accused have been arrested.

154.title: Sri Lankan Prez hasn't taken refuge at Air Force chief's home, says SLAF
154.article_body: A Sri Lanka Air Force spokesman on Tuesday rejected reports that President Gotabaya Rajapaksa was currently staying at a house belonging to SLAF chief Air Marshal Sudarshana Pathirana. "There was no truth behind the reports and it was propaganda to tarnish the image of the SLAF and its chief," he added. Pathirana also rejected the claim made by the reports.

155.title: Aamir was constantly on painkillers while filming 'Laal...' running scene: Report
155.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan was constantly on painkillers while filming the running sequence in his upcoming film 'Laal Singh Chaddha', as per reports. The actor had reportedly suffered a knee injury and was undergoing physiotherapy at the time. The reports added that Aamir didn't want to wait for the shoot because the film had already been delayed due to the pandemic.

156.title: Vidyut Jammwal & Nandita Mahtani to tie the knot in London this month: Reports
156.article_body: Vidyut Jammwal will reportedly tie the knot with fashion designer Nandita Mahtani in London this month. According to reports, they might make the news of their wedding public in the next 15 days. Nandita is currently in London and Vidyut will reportedly join her soon. Vidyut confirmed he's dating Nandita by sharing a picture with her on Instagram last year.

157.title: 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani' will face criticism: Karan Johar
157.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar has said that his upcoming film 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani' will face criticism, adding that it is good since it helps him improve. "I read the criticism before the praise...What's bad or what's mediocre needs to be told," he added. 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani' features Alia Bhatt, Ranveer Singh, Shabana Azmi and Dharmendra.

158.title: HCL Tech Q1 profit rises 2.11% to ₹3,281 crore, company declares ₹10 dividend
158.article_body: HCL Technologies on Tuesday reported a consolidated net profit of ₹3,281 crore in the June quarter, up 2.11% from ₹3,213 crore in the corresponding quarter last year. The company's consolidated revenue increased by 16.92% to ₹23,464 crore as against ₹20,068 crore reported in the year-ago period. The company has declared a dividend of ₹10 per share.

159.title: Former Punjab MLA Simarjeet Bains booked for ignoring court summons
159.article_body: Former Punjab MLA Simarjeet Singh Bains was booked for skipping court summons a day after he surrendered before a Ludhiana court in a rape case. An FIR under Section 174A of the Indian Penal Code has been registered at the division number 5 police station on the orders of Chief Judicial Magistrate Sumit Makkar.

160.title: Indian eagle-owl rescued from school premises in Thane amid rains
160.article_body: An Indian eagle-owl was rescued from a school in Thane on Monday amidst heavy rainfall. "The owl was attacked by crows and was trying to hide in the school. It was wet and in trauma," a member of NGO Wildlife Welfare Association (WWA) said. A veterinarian has confirmed that there were no external or internal injuries.

161.title: BJP leaders should support 'old friend' Sinha in Prez polls: Baghel
161.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Tuesday appealed to the BJP leaders to support "their old friend Yashwant Sinha" in the upcoming Presidential elections. "If the BJP is listening to its inner voice, their old friend (Yashwant Sinha) is the candidate of the Opposition," he said when asked about BJP's appeal to support NDA Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu.

162.title: Fire breaks out in building in Delhi's Janakpuri, 4 rescued
162.article_body: A fire broke out in an office in Delhi's Janakpuri on Tuesday. The fire was reported on the 11th floor of the Kirti Shikhar tower located near Janak Puri Police Station. Around 11 fire tenders attended the scene and four persons were rescued. According to officials, no casualty was reported. They said the incident was reported at around 12:30 pm.

163.title: It was blown out of proportion: Vikram on hospitalisation over chest discomfort
163.article_body: Tamil actor Vikram has reacted to the reports of being hospitalised over a heart attack, saying that he had suffered mild chest discomfort. "But it was blown out of proportion. I am doing well," the actor added. He was admitted to Chennai's Kauvery Hospital on Friday ahead of the audio launch of his upcoming Tamil film 'Cobra'.

164.title: Crocodile held captive in MP as people claim it 'swallowed' 10-yr-old boy, pic surfaces
164.article_body: A crocodile was captured by residents of a village who insisted that the reptile had swallowed a 10-year-old boy bathing in a river in Madhya Pradesh's Sheopur district. The villagers captured the crocodile using a net, insisting that the child was still alive in its stomach, an official said. A team from the police and forest department rescued the crocodile.

165.title: Woman extorts ₹56 lakh from elected representative in Mumbai, booked
165.article_body: Mumbai's Sakinaka Police have booked a woman for allegedly extorting ₹56 lakh from an elected representative in Maharashtra by threatening to tarnish his personal and political image. According to police, the woman met complainant in 2020 and sought monetary assistance from him. She allegedly blackmailed the man, claiming that she'll expose their 'illicit affair' if he didn't give the money.

166.title: Tamil Nadu CM tests COVID-19 positive, urges citizens to wear masks
166.article_body: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin on Tuesday said that he has tested positive for coronavirus and is under isolation. Taking to Twitter, the CM added that he got himself tested as he was "feeling a bit tired". Stalin also urged citizens to wear masks, get vaccinated against COVID-19 and stay safe.

167.title: Statue atop Parliament is a copy of National Emblem: Sculptor on 'distortion' claims
167.article_body: Sculptor Sunil Deore has refuted claims of 'distorting' expression of lions in the National Emblem statue installed on top of the new Parliament building. "We've tried to perfectly copy the sculpture at Sarnath," said Deore, adding, "We studied the original sculpture before enlarging it." Many opposition leaders have claimed the lions were made to look "angry" in the new sculpture.

168.title: I feel like an underdog, people don't consider me among top heroines: Taapsee
168.article_body: Actress Taapsee Pannu said she doesn't feel "very settled with" the fact that she's headlining films now. "I still feel like an underdog. If you ask a layman who are...top 2-3 heroines of the industry, I don’t think I'll be on that list," she added. "You have those days when you feel...Why am I still not there," Taapsee said.

169.title: 3 arrested for mobile phone thefts in Mumbai, 26 phones recovered
169.article_body: Three people were arrested and 26 stolen mobile phones were recovered from their possession in Mumbai's Kurla, police said on Tuesday. One of the accused (Arif Khokhar) stole mobile phones and sold them to the other accused at a cheaper rate, a police official said. Khokhar is a drug addict with multiple mobile phone thefts to his name, he added.

170.title: Barmy Army troll Virat Kohli for missing first ODI against England, fans react
170.article_body: England's Barmy Army trolled Virat Kohli for missing first ODI against England due to a groin strain. Sharing a picture, Barmy Army insinuated that Kohli has been dropped and injury was just an excuse. "This is disrespectful. You guys are crossing limits," a fan tweeted. Another wrote, "It'll be better you google 'How to play Bumrah' rather than making...useless memes."

171.title: England record lowest-ever score at the fall of 5th wicket against India in ODI cricket
171.article_body: England today recorded the lowest-ever score at the fall of fifth wicket against India in ODIs. England were restricted to 26/5 in 7.5 overs in the first ODI. Jason Roy, Joe Root, Ben Stokes and Liam Livingstone got out without scoring a run. The previous lowest ODI score at the fall of fifth wicket against India was 29/5 by Pakistan.

172.title: Siblings aged 4,5 & 8 drown in pit filled with rainwater in Pune
172.article_body: Three siblings, aged four, five and eight, drowned in a pit filled with rainwater on a farm in Ambethan village under the Pune district on Tuesday. Farmers had dug up a pit in which water had accumulated after heavy rain, said Inspector Dnyaneshwar Sabale, in-charge of Mahalunge police station. Siblings were playing on the farm in the morning, he added.

173.title: Class 12 student arrested for 'objectionable' FB post on UP CM
173.article_body: A Class 12 student has been arrested for allegedly posting an objectionable photograph of Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Facebook, police said. The accused, an 18-year-old boy named Ashish Yadav, had allegedly drawn something on the photograph. Police said they've seized his mobile phone and are investigating his other posts. Yadav is a resident of a village in Talgram.

174.title: Erdogan and Putin discussed Ukraine, duo to meet soon: Kremlin
