174.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin and his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdogan held a telephonic discussion regarding facilitation of Ukrainian grain exports through the Black Sea, the Kremlin said on Monday. Both leaders plan to meet in the near future following the discussion, the Kremlin added. Turkey has been mediating between Moscow and Kyiv since the beginning of the ongoing war.

175.title: He's a great kid but he's got demons, in a way: McEnroe on Kyrgios
175.article_body: Talking about 2022 Wimbledon finalist Nick Kyrgios, ex-world number one John McEnroe said the Australian is a great kid and he's well liked in the locker room. "He does a lot of charity work. But he's got demons, in a way," he added. "Kyrgios moves the needle for us in tennis, we need this big time," McEnroe further said.

176.title: 10 Nigerians arrested in Gr Noida for possessing cannabis, liquor
176.article_body: Ten Nigerian nationals were arrested for possessing cannabis and a large quantity of liquor in Greater Noida on Monday. Over 300 gms of cannabis, 217 cans and bottles of beer and 17 bottles of whiskey were recovered from an apartment, a police spokesperson said. The arrested foreigners failed to produce valid documents for their stay in India, another official said.

177.title: Petition in Sri Lanka SC seeking travel ban on Rajapaksas, others
177.article_body: A petition has been filed in Sri Lanka's SC seeking an interim order restraining ex-PM Mahinda Rajapaksa, ex-Finance Minister Basil Rajapaksa and other former ministers from travelling abroad without prior approval of the apex court. The petition was filed after Basil Rajapaksa was stopped from leaving at the Colombo airport. Notably, the whereabouts of President Gotabaya Rajapaksa is not known.

178.title: Cong appoints Raj, Chhattisgarh CMs as observers for Guj & HP polls
178.article_body: Congress on Tuesday appointed Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot and Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel as senior observers for the upcoming Assembly elections in Gujarat and Himachal Pradesh. TS Singh Deo and Milind Deora have been appointed observers for the Gujarat polls, while Sachin Pilot and Partap Singh Bajwa will be observers for the Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections, a party statement said.

179.title: Naga Chaitanya is very pure, honest and that inspires me: Krithi Shetty
179.article_body: Speaking about working with actor Naga Chaitanya in Venkat Prabhu's next, actress Krithi Shetty said, "I'm extremely excited to work with him because now that we have already worked together and I know how chill it is to work with him." "I have seen Chaitanya...he is really very soft, pure, honest and kind, and that inspires me," she added.

180.title: MNS chief postpones rally with party workers amid heavy rains in Maha
180.article_body: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) chief Raj Thackeray has postponed his rally with MNS workers which was scheduled for July 13, due to heavy rains in various parts of Maharashtra. He informed workers that he will soon announce the next date of his rally. He also asked party workers to reach out to the people affected due to heavy rains.

181.title: No shortage of funds for undertaking relief & rescue works: K'taka CM
181.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Tuesday said there is no shortage of funds for undertaking rescue and relief operations when many parts of the state are reeling under floods. Bommai said ₹730 crore is available with the National Disaster Response Fund (NDRF). "I too am visiting the affected areas...and will issue necessary instructions for rescue and relief works," Bommai added.

182.title: Russia fines Apple $33,900 for alleged data storage violation: Report
182.article_body: A court in Russia fined Apple 2 million roubles ($33,900) on Tuesday for allegedly refusing to store the data of Russian citizens on Russian territory, the news agency Interfax reported. Previously, the US tech giant was fined by the Netherlands several times for failing to comply with an order to provide non-Apple payment methods for dating apps.

183.title: Cut GST on substitutes to banned single-use plastic items: Minister
183.article_body: Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai wrote to Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Tuesday, demanding a reduction in the GST rates on the substitutes for the banned single-use plastic items. "This will reduce, to some extent, the challenges being faced by the users and the manufacturers," Rai wrote in the letter.

184.title: Retail inflation eases marginally to 7.01% in June
184.article_body: The country’s retail inflation, which is measured by the Consumer Price Index (CPI), eased to 7.01% in the month of June. It stood at 7.04% in May. This comes amid easing crude and edible oil prices. Further, India's factory output, measured in terms of Index of Industrial Production (IIP), witnessed a growth of 19.6% in May.

185.title: Varun, Janhvi visit Auschwitz Camp in Poland to prep for 'Bawaal'
185.article_body: Actors Varun Dhawan and Janhvi Kapoor visited the Auschwitz Camp in Poland as part of their preparation for Nitesh Tiwari directorial 'Bawaal'. Auschwitz was the largest concentration camp under Nazi Germany's rule. The actors visited like tourists and heard the history of World War 2 in a pre-recorded tape. The film is reportedly in the last stage of shooting.

186.title: Wow! Great moment: Nadal reacts to Djokovic's post from Wimbledon court
186.article_body: Rafael Nadal has congratulated Novak Djokovic for winning his seventh Wimbledon title. Djokovic had posted a video on Instagram, wherein his children can be seen running on the Wimbledon court. Nadal commented on the post, saying, "Wow! Great moment. Enjoy it and many congrats!" Nadal had pulled out of the tournament before the semifinal due to an abdominal injury.

187.title: Peace, stability shouldn't be disturbed in Darjeeling: Mamata Banerjee
187.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday called for peace and stability in Darjeeling. She was speaking at the swearing-in ceremony of the elected members of the Gorkhaland Territorial Administration (GTA), where elections were held after a gap of 10 years. "If few leaders try to instigate violence, don't allow them to do so," Mamata Banerjee said.

188.title: Delhi Police arrest man tasked with killing rival gang's members
188.article_body: The Delhi Police's Crime Branch on Tuesday claimed to have averted a possible gang war with the arrest of a man who was allegedly directed to eliminate gangster Neeraj Bawania and his gang members. The accused was also involved in the 2017 killing of gangster Kala Aasodiya, the uncle of Bawania while being produced in a Jhajjar court.

189.title: 4 killed, 11 injured in 2 separate road accidents in Odisha
189.article_body: Four people were killed and 11 got injured in two separate road accidents in Odisha's Subarnapur and Khordha districts. In the first accident in Subarnapur, a car rammed into a parked autorickshaw and a motorbike leading to the death of three people. In another accident, one person was killed after a truck collided with a passenger bus, police said.

190.title: Shiv Sena will support NDA's Presidential candidate Murmu: Uddhav Thackeray
190.article_body: Shiv Sena will support Droupadi Murmu for Presidential elections, the party's chief Uddhav Thackeray announced on Tuesday. This came after Sena MP and spokesperson Sanjay Raut had said, "Supporting Droupadi Murmu does not mean supporting BJP." He said Sena shared a "good relationship" with Opposition's Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha but will not act "under pressure".

191.title: Aren't Muslims Indian natives?: Owaisi on Yogi's 'population' remark
191.article_body: AIMIM's Asaduddin Owaisi on Tuesday criticised UP CM Yogi Adityanath's "population imbalance" remark. "Are Muslims not natives of India? If we see the reality, natives are only tribals and Dravidian(s)," Owaisi said. His remarks come after Yogi said population control measures shouldn't cause imbalance in population growth percentages between 'mool nivasi' (native residents) and other communities.

192.title: Chhattisgarh panchayat offers ₹1 lakh to minor girl raped by 4 men
192.article_body: A minor girl was raped by 4 men in Chhattisgarh, following which the panchayat tried to bury the matter and ordered the accused to pay the survivor ₹1 lakh, police said on Tuesday. The accused intercepted the 16-year-old, who was returning from a wedding and took her to a nearby forest and raped her, Jashpur ASP Pratibha Pandey said.

193.title: Ukraine claims long-range rocket strike on Russian-held territory
193.article_body: Ukraine on Tuesday claimed that it had carried out a long-range rocket strike against Russian forces in Ukraine's Kherson region. Ukraine said that 52 Russians were killed in the attack, but a Russian-installed official in Kherson put the death toll at seven. This comes as Ukraine plans to retake its occupied regions in a counter-offensive.

194.title: Time to look beyond Shardul, Vihari, Gill: Ghavri on India's Test team
194.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Karsan Ghavri said it's time to look beyond Hanuma Vihari, Shardul Thakur and Shubman Gill in India's Test side. "Sarfaraz Khan and Suryakumar Yadav need to be drafted into the Test team as soon as possible. They're the future stars of Indian cricket," he added. India last played a Test, the rescheduled fifth Test against England, in Birmingham.

195.title: Seven injured including school children after bus hits 4 vehicles in Kolkata
195.article_body: Seven people were injured including four school children after a bus hit four separate vehicles in south Kolkata's Bakultala area. The bus hit an autorickshaw from behind and two others at around 8 am, police said. The local mob vandalised the bus and alleged that the bus driver was drunk and was driving quite recklessly, police added.

196.title: SpiceJet Dubai-Madurai flight nose wheel malfunctions, airline's 9th glitch in 24 days
196.article_body: A Dubai-Madurai SpiceJet flight was delayed on Monday after the plane's nose wheel malfunctioned at the last minute, DGCA officials said as per PTI. Confirming the issue, the airline said it sent an "alternate aircraft" to bring passengers back to India. This is reportedly the ninth technical fault that a SpiceJet flight has faced in 24 days.

197.title: Jaishankar's visit to Kerala aimed at 2024 LS polls: Vijayan
197.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan said External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar's three-day visit to the state is aimed at the 2024 Lok Sabha polls. "It was heard that...responsibility to ensure BJP's victory in...Lok Sabha seat was entrusted to Jaishankar," Vijayan said. "When...a [foreign] minister [goes] to inspect the flyover at Kazhakuttom, the people can...[see] real intention behind it," he added.

198.title: Biden will push for more oil output on Middle East visit: US NSA
198.article_body: President Joe Biden will urge leaders of OPEC nations to increase oil production when he meets them in Saudi Arabia this week, US NSA Jake Sullivan said on Monday. Biden will depart on Tuesday night for his first trip to the Middle East as president. Besides Saudi Arabia, Biden will visit Israel and the West Bank during his trip.

199.title: Moved to UK overnight: Agarwal on how he became 1st Indian to list firm in London market
199.article_body:
Vedanta Chairman Anil Agarwal posted an old picture and shared how he became the first Indian
to list his firm on the London Stock Exchange in 2003. He wrote, "My wife...thought I was crazy when I told her that we are moving to London overnight...I didn't have much when I arrived...but had...the...blessings of my margdarshak (guide)- my parents."

200.title: Had arranged marriage, met husband on matrimonial site: Amruta Pawar
200.article_body: Marathi television actress Amruta Pawar has revealed that her marriage with biomedical engineer Neel Patil was an arranged one. “We met on a matrimonial site. We started speaking in January and it was a courtship of six months,” the actress added. Amruta and Neel got married recently in July and announced their engagement in April.

201.title: Deepika Padukone-backed Mokobara raises $6.5 mn in Series A round
201.article_body: Luggage brand Mokobara, backed by Deepika Padukone, has raised $6.5 million in its Series A funding round. The round, led by Saama Capital and Sauce VC, saw participation from investors such as Mamaearth Co-founder Varun Alagh, Urban Ladder Co-founder Ashish Goel, and founders of Licious, among others. The D2C brand was founded in 2019 by Navin Parwal and Sangeet Agrawal.

202.title: Ice-cream that doesn't melt when exposed to fire raises food safety concerns in China
202.article_body: A luxury Chinese ice-cream brand has revealed that their products don't melt at high temperatures. When exposed to fire, the ice-cream appeared to burn instead, prompting both customers and local authorities to ask what's in the dessert. Although the company, Zhong Xue Gao, stated its products are in line with quality standards, an officer said the matter is being investigated.

203.title: EU has frozen $13.8 bn of Russian assets over Ukraine war: Official
203.article_body: The European Union has frozen Russian assets worth $13.8 billion held by Russian oligarchs, other people and entities sanctioned for Moscow's war against Ukraine, EU Justice Commissioner Didier Reynders said. "A...large part, over 12 billion comes from five member states," he added. The bloc currently has 98 entities and nearly 1,160 individuals blacklisted for Russia's role in Ukraine.

204.title: India announce their playing XI for 1st ODI against England, Kohli out due to injury
204.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to bowl first against England in the first ODI. At the toss, Rohit revealed that Virat Kohli will not feature in the match due to a niggle. Shreyas Iyer will bat at the number three position for India. Meanwhile, Shikhar Dhawan is featuring in his 150th ODI.

205.title: Neymar is as good as Cristiano Ronaldo and Messi, if not better: Cicinho
205.article_body: Talking about Neymar, ex-Real Madrid defender Cicinho said the Paris Saint-Germain (PSG) forward is as good as Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo and teammate Lionel Messi, if not better. PSG bought Neymar from Barcelona in 2017. In the last five years, Neymar has won every major trophy in France and has scored 100 goals for the Paris-based club.

206.title: Delhi Police to deploy 2,000 personnel for Kanwar Yatra; release route map
206.article_body: Over 2,000 traffic personnel will be deployed by the Delhi Police to ensure smooth flow of traffic especially across the capital's east and northeast districts during the Kanwar Yatra. Also, 338 Kanwariya camps have been approved out of which 172 are government approved, police said. Notably, the police have also released a route map for vehicular movement during the procession.

207.title: CISF jawan loses ₹1.5 lakh while updating Aadhaar card in Navi Mumbai
207.article_body: A 36-year-old CISF jawan was cheated of ₹1.50 lakh while he was trying to update his Aadhaar card online in Navi Mumbai. "Before linking, he had to update...Aadhaar card and...he did a Google search on the nearest centres," police said. He then received an SMS, asking him to download an application, after which the money was deducted from his account.

208.title: Stalker stabs class 12 girl in Madhya Pradesh's Jhansi
208.article_body: A class 12 girl was reportedly stabbed by her stalker outside her tutor's home in Jhansi. She has been hospitalised with deep wounds on her neck and face. The girl's mother alleged that the accused had been harassing and stalking her daughter for two years. Police said that both of them knew each other and used to talk on phone.

209.title: Sri Lankans turn to bicycles for commute amid soaring fuel prices
209.article_body: Several Sri Lankans are purchasing bicycles for their daily commute amid soaring fuel prices due to the country's economic crisis. Many bicycle stores in the country have run out of stock and several others have recorded a spike in sales. The current price of petrol in the country is LKR 470/litre, while diesel is priced at LKR 460/litre.

210.title: Man who broke into CM Mamata's house had 11 SIM cards, visited Bangladesh
210.article_body: The man who was arrested for entering the premises of West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's residence by crossing over a wall, was found to be possessing at least 11 SIM cards, police said. The 30-year-old accused allegedly used them to make calls to Bihar, Jharkhand and Bangladesh and had also visited Bangladesh without valid documents last year.

211.title: Novak better than Nadal, Federer across parameters: Ex-US Open winner
211.article_body: Former US Open winner Nikola Pilic said Novak Djokovic is better than Rafael Nadal and Roger Federer by all parameters. "He was the number one player in the world for 374 weeks which is impressive. Also, no one except him has won all the Grand Slam titles twice, and Novak has a positive head-to-head with almost all players," added Pilic.

212.title: Official arrested for seeking ₹1.5 lakh bribe from sarpanch in MP
212.article_body: A revenue official in Madhya Pradesh's Shivpuri district was arrested on Tuesday for allegedly seeking a bribe of ₹1.5 lakh from a man who was elected as a village sarpanch. The official, Sudhakar Tiwari, demanded the bribe in exchange of issuing the victory certificate to the complainant, who recently won the panchayat election by five votes.

213.title: Number of Assam residents killed in Manipur landslide rises to 15
213.article_body: The number of Assam residents killed in the landslide in Manipur's Noney district has risen to 15, an official said on Tuesday. Bodies of two persons from Assam's Morigaon district, engaged as labourers at Tupul railway yard construction site, were retrieved from under the debris on Monday, he said. Another six people from Assam are still missing, the official added.

214.title: Pune records season’s wettest day on Tuesday, on red alert till Thursday
214.article_body: Pune, on Tuesday recorded the season's wettest day with Shivajinagar observatory recording 46 mm of rainfall in the last 24 hours. Reports said the India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a red alert for Pune district till Thursday. Warning of possibilities of extremely heavy rainfall at isolated places, mainly in the ghat areas till July 14, has also been issued.

215.title: I stay off the internet: Camila on dealing with scrutiny post breakup with Shawn
215.article_body: Speaking about how she's protecting herself from public comments post her breakup with Shawn Mendes, Camila Cabello said, "It's the same way I protect my emotions with everything else." "I...stay off [the internet]. I don't look at what anyone says and wait for time to do its thing," she added. Camila said romantic relationships aren't her priority at the moment.

216.title: SRK's 'Dunki' DOP quits film due to 'creative differences' with Hirani
216.article_body: Amit Roy, DOP (Director of Photography) of Shah Rukh Khan-starrer 'Dunki', has quit the project due to "creative differences" with director Rajkumar Hirani. "We both couldn't see from the same angle," Amit told Etimes. "But...the parting was very amicable. We both sat down and then I quit. Honestly, I didn't want it to reach a stage of friction," he added.

217.title: Watch clearly, didn't speak wrongly with Rohit: Pratik on misbehaviour reports
217.article_body: Actor Pratik Sehajpal took to Twitter to share a statement over reports of him misbehaving with filmmaker Rohit Shetty on 'Khatron Ke Khiladi 12'. "Please watch the episode clearly! Not once did I speak wrong[ly] with Rohit sir...I really respect him...I'm grateful to God that I got chance to even meet him...I was talking to someone else," he wrote.

218.title: Thane man gets 10 yrs in jail for sexually assaulting 7-yr-old girl
218.article_body: A special court sentenced 26-year-old Sajad Aslam Kankali to 10 years of rigorous imprisonment for kidnapping and sexually assaulting a seven-year-old girl in Thane. The judge also imposed a fine of ₹13,000 on him. The incident took place in 2015, when the accused abducted the minor, took her to a forested area and sexually assaulted her, special public prosecutor said.

219.title: Will defend Philippines if it's attacked in South China Sea: US
219.article_body: As part of the 1951 US-Philippines Mutual Defense Treaty, the US will defend the Philippines if Philippine forces come under attack in the South China Sea, US State Secretary Antony Blinken said on Monday. Blinken's comments came on the sixth anniversary of a 2016 ruling by an international tribunal that invalidated Beijing's vast claims in the South China Sea.

220.title: Govt forms new trade advisory body; onboards TCS CEO, KKR India chief
220.article_body: The government has constituted a new Board of Trade, an advisory body to the Commerce and Industry Ministry. The 29-member board has been constituted by merging it with the existing Council for Trade Development and Promotion (CTDP), a notification by the Directorate General of Foreign Trade announced. The body includes TCS CEO Rajesh Gopinathan and KKR India Chairman Sanjay Nayyar.

221.title: Why has Supreme Court told govt to consider enacting a 'Bail Act'?
221.article_body: The Supreme Court said that the Centre should consider the enactment of a separate bail law or 'Bail Act' to "streamline the grant of bails". Over two-thirds of prison inmates in India are undertrial prisoners, a majority of whom may not be required to be arrested, SC said. A democracy can't give the impression of a "police state", it added.

222.title: Jayeshbhai Jordaar's fate shouldn't be judged by its box office: Director
222.article_body: 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' director Divyang Thakkar spoke about the film's underwhelming performance at the box office and said, "[Its] fate shouldn't be judged by...box office." "Audience these days is interested in going to theatres only for...larger-than-life experiences," he added. Divyang further said he's happy that the film found its audience through OTT.

223.title: Sena hasn't extended its support to anyone: NCP on Prez elections
223.article_body: Maharashtra NCP leader Chhagan Bhujbal on Tuesday said that the Shiv Sena has not extended its support to anyone in the upcoming Presidential elections. "It is yet to make the final decision," Bhujbal said. This comes after Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said that the party discussed NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu in their meeting on Monday.

224.title: Assam Police recover 497 kg ganja from truck, miscreants set vehicle on fire
224.article_body: The police recovered 497 kg of ganja from a truck in Assam's Srirampur on Monday, following which the empty vehicle, which was parked near a police outpost, was set on fire by some miscreants at night. The truck's driver was arrested by the police. A police official said that firefighters were able to bring the blaze under control.

225.title: Video of fake IPL in Gujarat that was created to cheat Russian punters goes viral
225.article_body: A video of fake IPL in Gujarat that was organised to cheat Russian punters has gone viral. The clip that has gone viral showed how the camera displayed just one angle of the match. Several labourers acted as players for the fake IPL, which was broadcast on YouTube. Russian punters used to place bets on the tournament through Telegram.

226.title: We always discuss what we're reading: Sara on bonding with dad over books
226.article_body: Actress Sara Ali Khan opened up about how she and her actor-father, Saif Ali Khan, bond over history and books, and said that they always tell each other what they are reading. "He recommended Anna Karenina to me, but I read...classics...from Odyssey to Inferno. I told my father about them and...he got them all and started reading too," she added.

227.title: Ajay is a deeply intense & private man, Akshay is a lot of fun: Johar
227.article_body: Talking about Ajay Devgn and Akshay Kumar, filmmaker Karan Johar said, "Ajay's a deeply intense, private...silent man, but he'll say one word and it'll be impactful...He says one line and that...will be a trending line." "Akshay is a lot of fun...His episode with Samantha Ruth Prabhu [in the seventh season of 'Koffee with Karan'] is [a] riot," added Johar.

228.title: Shami has good opportunity in England ODIs to vouch for T20 WC spot: Parthiv
228.article_body: Ex-wicketkeeper-batter Parthiv Patel has said pacer Mohammad Shami has a good opportunity in England ODIs to vouch for his spot in India's squad for the 2022 T20 World Cup. "India already have Bhuvneshwar and Bumrah...if you get the quality and experience of Shami, it'll make a huge difference," stated Parthiv. Shami last played T20Is in the 2021 T20 World Cup.

229.title: Humanity closer than ever to irreversible climate breakdown: Expert
229.article_body: Sir James Bevan, the head of the Environment Agency, has warned that 60 years on, humanity is closer than ever to irreversible climate breakdown. Moreover, as per a report, a quarter of England's mammals are facing extinction. "The biodiversity crisis is a crisis because it won't just kill...plants and animals it is killing, it will kill us too," Bevan said.

230.title: Indian Railways' AC double decker coach runs at 180 kmph, video surfaces
230.article_body: Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw took to Twitter to share a video of an LHB AC double decker coach clocking a speed of 180 kmph during a trial. He wrote, "New speed of New India. Trial conducted for 180 kmph." The speed trial was successfully conducted on Kota-Nagda section of West Central Railway.

231.title: 2 booked for rape after minor Punjab girl found 4 months pregnant
231.article_body: Two unidentified men were booked for raping a 17-year-old girl after she was found to be four months pregnant. The incident came to light when the girl was taken to hospital after complaining about stomach ache. The girl claimed that accused had sedated and raped her and threatened to make the video viral if she didn't pay them ₹1 lakh.

232.title: Rupee closes at all-time low of 79.60 against US dollar
232.article_body: The Indian rupee ended at a record low of 79.60 (provisional) against the US dollar on Tuesday. The currency witnessed an intra-day high of 79.53 and a low of 79.66 against the US dollar in Tuesday’s trade. Meanwhile, the euro reached parity with the US dollar for the first time in 20 years on Tuesday.

233.title: Pics show waterlogging, traffic jam amid heavy rainfall in several parts of India
233.article_body: Waterlogging and traffic congestion was witnessed in several parts of the country, including Delhi, Mumbai, Uttar Pradesh and Gujarat, amid heavy rainfall. This comes as red alert has been issued in several areas of Gujarat and Maharashtra, with IMD predicting extremely heavy rainfall in the region. Extremely heavy rainfall has also been predicted over Goa.

234.title: Martin Scorsese screens Malayalam film 'Kummatty' at The Film Foundation
234.article_body: Filmmaker Martin Scorsese screened 1979 Malayalam film 'Kummatty' at his 'The Film Foundation' on Monday. The Aravindan Govindan directorial was restored and showcased in The Film Foundation Restoration Screening Room. The filmmaker wrote on Instagram, "KUMMATTY is an adaptation of a Central Kerala folktale...A sweet and engaging story and a visually stunning film, KUMMATTY is a must-see."

235.title: GHMC asks citizens to plan commute accordingly amid rainfall in Hyderabad
235.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation's (GHMC) Enforcement, Vigilance and Disaster Management (EVDM) wing on Tuesday asked citizens to plan their commute accordingly amid rainfall in the city. It also issued an alert for moderate rainfall along with gusty winds in Hyderabad for next 12 hours. "Tree falls may be expected. DRF teams on high alert," EVDM Director tweeted.

236.title: TMC MP questions Smriti Irani's appointment as Minority Affairs Minister, Rijiju responds
236.article_body: Questioning Minority Affairs Minister Smriti Irani's appointment, TMC MP Jawhar Sircar tweeted, "Hardcore Hindu, married to a Parsi given charge of Muslims, Christians. Is this BJP's secularism?" Kiren Rijiju replied, Muslims, Sikhs, Christians, Buddhists, Jain and Parsis are all minority communities, adding, "I hope one can free mind from the shackles of pseudo secularism & appeasement politics."

237.title: CSK, MI, DC show interest in bids for South Africa's new T20 league
237.article_body: Cricket South Africa has invited bids from interested parties for an upcoming T20 competition in the country. The board has received 29 expressions of interest till now which include Chennai Super Kings, Mumbai Indians, Delhi Capitals, owners of Pakistan Super League franchises and a party led by former English cricketer Kevin Pietersen. CSA plans to hold the tournament in January-February.

238.title: BJP has nothing to do with 'rebellion' in Goa Congress: Goa CM
238.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Tuesday said the BJP has nothing to do with the "rebellion" in the state Congress Legislature Party. Congress had accused MLA Michael Lobo and former CM Digambar Kamat of "conspiring and hobnobbing" with the ruling BJP to engineer a split in the party's legislative wing. On Sunday, five Congress MLAs in Goa had gone incommunicado.

239.title: 2 Ghaziabad men held for cheating people who wanted to book OYO rooms
239.article_body: The Noida Police arrested two Ghaziabad-based members of a gang for allegedly cheating people on the pretext of booking rooms in OYO Hotels and recovered ₹79,000 cash from them. The accused would somehow access the data of victims by posing as OYO Hotel staff and would ask them to transfer the booking amount for the rooms to the bank account.

240.title: PM to attend 1st India-Israel-UAE-US leaders' virtual meet on July 14
240.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will attend the first I2U2 (India-Israel-UAE-US) Leaders' Virtual Summit on July 14. Besides PM Modi, US President Joe Biden, Israeli PM Yair Lapid and UAE President Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan will participate in the summit. Notably, the summit will be held during Biden's four-day tour of the Middle East.

241.title: Officer gets show-cause notice for serving poor quality tea to MP CM
241.article_body: A junior civil supplies officer was on Tuesday served a show-cause notice for serving poor quality and cold tea to Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan during a visit to Khajuraho, an officer said. According to the notice, MP CM, along with some other guests, were served tea at Khajuraho airport on Monday, while campaigning for a civic body election.

242.title: Italy to start administering 2nd COVID-19 booster shot to over-60s
242.article_body: Italy will soon start administering a second COVID-19 booster shot to people aged over 60, Health Minister Roberto Speranza said. This comes after EU health agencies recommended the second booster dose for vulnerable people and those over 60. "All...scientific evidence...shows that an extra booster dose can greatly protect people, especially the frail and elderly, from hospitalisation," he added.

243.title: Kartik, Nushrratt, Sonnalli attend 'Pyaar...' co-star Ishita's b'day party
243.article_body: 'Pyaar Ka Punchnama 2' actors Kartik Aaryan, Omkar Kapoor, Sunny Singh, Nushrratt Bharuccha and Sonnalli Seygall reunited in Mumbai for co-star Ishita Raj's birthday on Monday. Nushrratt and Sonnalli took to their respective Instagram handles to share some pictures from the party. 'Pyaar Ka Punchnama 2' was a comedy-drama film directed by Luv Ranjan.

244.title: Samantha refused to use body doubles for action scenes in Yashoda: Makers
244.article_body: Director duo Hari Shankar and Haresh Narayan revealed that Samantha Ruth Prabhu refused to take any help for action scenes in her upcoming movie 'Yashoda'. "She wanted to do all the scenes herself. She...said no to body doubles...and even in a few scenes where...rope is required for safety, she did it on her own...She was totally enjoying it," they said.

245.title: Debt mutual funds see outflow of ₹92,248 cr in June: AMFI data
245.article_body: Mutual funds that invest in fixed-income securities, or debt funds, saw an outflow of ₹92,248 crore in June, Association of Mutual Funds in India (AMFI) data showed. Debt funds saw a net outflow of ₹32,722 crore in May and an inflow of ₹54,756 crore in April. Out of 16 fixed-income or debt fund categories, 14 witnessed net outflows in June.

246.title: Many Shiv Sena leaders, workers in touch with us: Maha CM Shinde
246.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde has claimed that many Shiv Sena leaders and workers are "in touch" with his faction. "The Deputy CM handled the government very well during his tenure as CM...Many people have faith in the government," Shinde added. This comes after Union Minister Raosaheb Patil Danve claimed 12 Shiv Sena MPs are in touch with Shinde's faction.

247.title: Supply chain startup Wheelocity raises $12 mn in Series A round
247.article_body: Early-stage supply chain startup Wheelocity, which handles fresh food supply for quick commerce companies, has raised $12 million in its Series A funding round. The funding round, which was a mix of debt and equity, was led by Lightspeed India Partners and saw participation from Anicut Capital and other investors. Wheelocity's clients include Swiggy Instamart, Dunzo, Blinkit, among others.

248.title: Mumbai professor rapes student at college, home for 2 yrs; arrested
248.article_body: A 42-year-old college professor has been arrested by Mumbai Police for allegedly raping his student for two years. Police said the accused allegedly raped her and forced her to perform unnatural sex in the college premises and at his home when she came for tuition between 2020 and 2022. The student was a minor when she was allegedly sexually assaulted.

249.title: Man slits woman's throat after argument inside Pune hotel room, held
249.article_body: A 30-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly killing a woman inside a hotel room in Pune, police said on Monday. The accused, identified as Sachin Raju Shinde, allegedly slit the victim's throat following an argument between them. The accused told police that the victim was demanding money from him and pressuring him to marry her.

250.title: 86 Chinese cities issue red alert after heatwave buckles roads
250.article_body: As many as 86 cities in China, including commercial capital Shanghai, have issued red alerts amid soaring temperatures due to the ongoing heatwave. The hot weather has buckled roads, popped roof tiles and driven people to seek refuge in underground raid shelters in many cities. China's Chongqing city has also deployed sanitation water-spraying trucks to keep its roads cool.

251.title: Hindu activists enter B'luru's Idgah Maidan to protest, detained
251.article_body: Bengaluru City Police has detained Hindu activists who entered the Idgah Maidan as part of a bandh called by the Chamarajpet Citizens' Federation on Tuesday. The activists claimed that the ground is for the public and not a property of the Waqf Board, limited for Muslims to offer prayers. DCP (West) said no permission was granted to hold the bandh.

252.title: 16-yr-old Chhattisgarh boy beaten to death in school; 4 minors detained
252.article_body: A 16-year-old student was beaten to death allegedly by four boys at a government school in Chhattisgarh's Raipur after a verbal fight over a petty issue, police said. Following the incident, four minor boys were detained, police added. The victim had gone to the school to appear in a Class 10 compartment exam, police further said.

253.title: Delhi Police arrests man, wife and daughter for holding dual passports
253.article_body: Delhi Police has arrested a man, his wife and their daughter, all residents of West Bengal, for allegedly holding dual passports. This comes after a complaint was filed against the accused by immigration officials for having French and Indian passports. "They disclosed themselves as Bangladeshi nationals and procured French passports...they paid ₹9 lakh to an agent," police said.

254.title: Now there's campaign for Tiranga to be flown from every home: Big B
254.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan recalled how he started hoisting the National Flag at his residence Jalsa on his blog. He wrote MP Naveen Jindal moved the court for the Tiranga to be hoisted at residential locations and won. "Immediately I started flying our National Flag...Now there's a campaign for it to be flown from every home with pride," the actor added.

255.title: Won't be surprised if England score 400 vs India: Vaughan on 1st ODI
255.article_body: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan said he "won't be surprised" if England score 400 in the first ODI against India. "England scored 498 against Netherlands...[and will be strong]," added Vaughan. England's white-ball skipper Jos Buttler earlier stated that they'll keep trying to score 500 runs in ODIs. England recently recorded their highest-ever total against India in T20Is, scoring 215 runs.

256.title: Pune traffic department collects ₹30 cr fine in 6 months using CCTVs
256.article_body: Pune traffic department has collected fines amounting to ₹30 crore using its CCTV camera surveillance system since January this year, police said. As many as 5.71 lakh violators were fined after they were spotted in the CCTV camera surveillance system. The fine recovered in June 2022 was ₹2.82 crore as compared to the monthly average of over ₹5 crore.

257.title: Unidentified people damage idol at temple in J&K's Kathua, FIR filed
257.article_body: An FIR was registered after some unidentified people allegedly damaged an idol at a temple in Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua, police said. Following the incident that took place on Monday, angry locals launched a protest and blocked the main road, demanding arrest of the culprits, police added. It's reportedly the third such incident in Jammu in the past three months.

258.title: Dog beaten, tied to a bomb by Russian soldiers to kill its rescuers in Ukraine
258.article_body: Russian soldiers beat a dog and tied it to a bomb to kill Ukrainian civilians coming to its rescue. Residents in Makariv, north west of Kyiv, called Ukrainian bomb disposal experts to rescue the canine. The dog, whose owner could not be found, has been named Fox and is making a recovery.

259.title: Euro reaches parity with US dollar for the first time in 20 years
259.article_body: The euro sank on Tuesday to reach parity with US dollar for the first time in 20 years. The currency fell to an intraday low of $1 amid concerns that an energy crisis could plunge the region's economy into recession. The concerns come after the biggest single pipeline carrying Russian natural gas to Europe was shutdown for maintenance.

260.title: Thank you Sri Lanka for hosting us during an extremely difficult time: Warner
260.article_body: After the conclusion of Australia's tour of Sri Lanka, David Warner shared a picture of the Sri Lankan flag and thanked the country for hosting them amid the economic and political crisis. "What I love about your amazing country is no matter the circumstances you always have a smile on your face and are always so welcoming," wrote Warner.

261.title: KL Rahul to marry Athiya Shetty in next 3 months in Mumbai: Reports
261.article_body: Cricketer KL Rahul will tie the knot with actress Athiya Shetty in the next three months, as per reports. "The wedding is expected to take place in next three months in Mumbai. It'll be a grand celebration for both families and every detail of...wedding is been overseen by the bride herself," India Today reported quoting a source as saying.

262.title: Govt releases list of 4 participants of India's 1st 5G spectrum auction
262.article_body: The Centre has released a list naming Adani Data Networks, Reliance Jio, Bharti Airtel and Vodafone Idea as the participants of India’s first 5G spectrum auction which will be held on July 26. A total of 72,097.85 MHz of airwaves will be auctioned and the winner will have the right to use the spectrum for 20 years.

263.title: Outlandish: Depp's lawyers on Heard asking for dismissal of trial verdict
263.article_body: Actor Johnny Depp's lawyers have called his ex-wife Amber Heard's request to dismiss the verdict of the defamation trial "outlandish". Heard's team had alleged that the wrong juror sat during the trial. Depp's team has argued that Heard's team should have spoken up at the time of the trial if they had concerns, adding that the juror was vetted.

264.title: Suryakumar has to play in 1st ODI vs England: Michael Vaughan
264.article_body: Former England captain Michael Vaughan has said Suryakumar Yadav has to play in the first ODI against England. "Suryakumar just played the most ridiculous innings," he added, referring to the 31-year-old's 117-run innings in the final T20I against England. "India have got so much quality and depth that they have just got to get the combinations right," Vaughan further said.

265.title: Secretary of Swapna Suresh's NGO arrested for threatening tribals in Kerala
265.article_body: Secretary of an NGO named High Range Rural Development Society (HRDS) which had employed Swapna Suresh, the key accused in Kerala's gold smuggling case, was arrested for allegedly threatening tribals in Palakkad. The Sholayur Police arrested the accused, Aji Krishnan, based on a complaint filed by a local tribal member. Notably, Krishnan has been booked under the SC/ST Atrocities Act.

266.title: Pune civic body to appoint agency to check green growth on bridges
266.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has floated a tender to appoint an agency to clear city bridges of green growth. "The agency appointed...will use crane(s) and other machinery to clear the plant growth as bridges are tall. The agency will use chemicals to check green growth," a PMC official said. PMC will also appoint an agency for the maintenance of bridges.

267.title: House of accused in Assam animal rights activist suicide case demolished
267.article_body: The house of Baidullah Khan, an accused in animal rights activist Vineet Bagaria's suicide case, was demolished on Tuesday by authorities in Assam's Dibrugarh. "The house was constructed without having the necessary building permits. The structure was unstable and unfit for people to reside," Dibrugarh DC said. Bagaria had died by suicide at his residence on July 7.

268.title: Father of school shooting victim shouts at US President during his speech; video surfaces
268.article_body: US President Joe Biden was heckled by the father of a school shooting victim during a White House event on Monday. Biden was talking about passage of a gun control bill when Manuel Oliver, whose son died in Parkland, Florida, in 2018, shouted that the US President must "do more". "Sit down...Let me finish my comments," Biden was heard saying.

269.title: Water level rises in 7 lakes used for supplying water to Mumbai
269.article_body: The water level has increased in the seven lakes supplying water to Mumbai due to continuous heavy rainfall. The combined water stock of all seven lakes has shot up to 5.8 lakh million litres of their total capacity or 40% of the annual total. The seven lakes are - Modak Sagar, Tansa, Vihar, Tulsi, Upper Vaitarna, Middle Vaitarna and Bhatsa.

270.title: Truck hits vehicle parked to change tyre in Punjab; 3 dead, 1 hurt
270.article_body: Three people were killed and one person was injured after a canter truck rammed into a pick-up truck parked on the roadside and its occupants who were changing the vehicle's tyre in Punjab's Dera Bassi on Monday. The deceased included the canter truck's driver. The canter truck's front was left completely damaged from the impact of the collision.

271.title: I learnt some incredible personal life lessons from Brad Pitt: Joey King
271.article_body: During her interview with Men's Journal, Joey King said Brad Pitt's 'Bullet Train' is "a larger-than-life film" that the actress can't believe she's a part of. "I learnt a lot from Brad, some incredible personal life lessons. He's been in the public eye for so long," she added. "Brad was so gracious in helping someone like me," she said.

272.title: My focus is definitely on 2023 WC: Dhawan ahead of 1st ODI vs England
272.article_body: Ahead of first India-England ODI, India opener Shikhar Dhawan said he has been practising for England ODIs and he's sure he'll be in fine rhythm in coming matches. "My focus is definitely on next year's World Cup...for that, I want to play as many matches as possible for India and do well there," he added. Match will be played today.

273.title: Former Himachal Pradesh BJP chief Khimi Ram joins Congress
273.article_body: Former Himachal Pradesh BJP chief Khimi Ram joined the Congress on Tuesday. Ram, a former minister and deputy speaker in the state, said he is not joining the Congress "out of any anger towards BJP". "I have taken a well-thought-out decision to take...Congress forward in Himachal Pradesh," Ram said. He was sworn in at AICC headquarters in New Delhi.

274.title: National flag temporarily removed from Hyd's tallest post to prevent damage
274.article_body: The Hyderabad authority has temporarily taken down the national flag from the tallest flag post in the city to prevent it from any damage amid the strong winds forecast for the city. The height of the flag post, located on the banks of Hussain Sagar Lake in Sanjeevaiah Park, is around 88 metres and it weighs over 65 kilograms.

275.title: The first-known pregnant mummy had cancer, reveals new study
275.article_body: A new study by Polish scientists said that the first-known pregnant Egyptian mummy had cancer in the nasopharynx (upper part of the throat behind the nose). The revelations were made when unusual markings were found in the nasopharyngeal bones of the mummy's skull. The woman is suspected to have had a malignant tumour and likely died from it, researchers said.

276.title: 5 districts in Delhi report deficient monsoon rains so far: IMD
276.article_body: Five districts in Delhi have reported deficient monsoon rains so far this year due to poor rainfall distribution, the IMD data stated. West Delhi and Southwest Delhi have recorded a rainfall deficit of 60% and 51%, respectively. On the other hand, Northeast Delhi has logged a shortfall of 43%, followed by Central Delhi at 29% and South Delhi at 22%.

277.title: Chivas Regal maker Pernod Ricard puts new India investments on hold: Report
277.article_body: French spirits group Pernod Ricard, the maker of Chivas Regal, Glenlivet Scotch whisky and Absolut vodka has put its new Indian investments on hold over long-running tax disputes with authorities on valuing liquor imports, as per a report. The company had also written a letter to PM Narendra Modi in November seeking a resolution in the matter.

278.title: PM Modi inaugurates Deoghar Airport in J'khand, flags off flight to Kolkata
278.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday inaugurated the 657-acre Deoghar Airport, constructed at a cost of ₹401 crore, in Jharkhand. The PM also flagged off the Deoghar-Kolkata IndiGo flight from the new airport, which has a 2,500-metre-long runway. Union Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya M Scindia said the airport will be linked to Ranchi, Patna and Delhi in the upcoming days.

279.title: No science to predict isolated extreme rain: Govt on Amarnath tragedy
279.article_body: After IMD said that the weather event at Amarnath was not a cloudburst but localised extreme rainfall, the Ministry of Earth Sciences Secretary Dr M Ravichandran said that no country has the science to make a forecast for such an event yet. "Just as there's no science to predict an earthquake, there's none for isolated extremely heavy rainfall," he said.

280.title: Japanese flock Tokyo streets to bid farewell to ex-PM Abe at funeral
280.article_body: Hundreds of Japanese citizens flocked streets of Tokyo to bid their final goodbyes to ex-PM Shinzo Abe on Tuesday as a private funeral service was held at a temple days after his assassination. The hearse carrying Abe's body passed through several significant buildings, including the Prime Minister's Office and parliament building. Abe will be cremated at city's Kirigaya Funeral Hall.

281.title: Russia reports its first case of monkeypox
281.article_body: Russia's consumer safety watchdog Rospotrebnadzor on Tuesday said that the country has detected its first case of monkeypox. "The infection was found in a young man who came back from a trip through European countries," it added. "The disease is proceeding in a mild form. There is no threat to life," it further said.

282.title: Lawrence Bishnoi bought ₹4 lakh rifle to kill Salman Khan in 2018: Report
282.article_body: Gangster Lawrence Bishnoi, who's being questioned in connection with Sidhu Moosewala's murder, has allegedly revealed during interrogation that he "wanted to kill" Salman Khan in 2018 over the 1998 blackbuck poaching case. According to a report, Bishnoi allegedly confessed to sending messages to his associate Sampat Nehra to kill Salman. The gangster reportedly also ordered a rifle for ₹4 lakh.

283.title: Cannot compare Suryakumar Yadav to AB de Villiers: Sanjay Manjrekar
283.article_body: Following Suryakumar Yadav's 117 in the third T20I against England comprising 14 fours and six sixes, Sanjay Manjrekar said Suryakumar cannot be compared to AB de Villiers. "AB did that many years back what Surya's doing currently," added Manjrekar. Suryakumar had a strike rate of 212.72. Parthiv Patel stated that it might be the best knock in India's T20I history.

284.title: Video of reverse waterfall in Maharashtra's Naneghat goes viral
284.article_body: A video of a reverse waterfall from Maharashtra's Naneghat has gone viral on social media. In the video, water can be seen sprawling upwards instead of falling down. Naneghat is a mountain pass between the Konkan coast and the ancient town of Junnar in Deccan plateau in the Western Ghats.

285.title: Which are the top 10 best cities in the world in 2022 as per Time Out?
285.article_body: As per the Time Out 2022 Index, Scotland's capital Edinburgh has been named the best city in the world. It is followed by Chicago, Medellin, Glasgow, Amsterdam, Prague and Marrakech. Berlin, Montreal and Copenhagen complete the top 10. Meanwhile, Mumbai has been ranked 14th, while Delhi has been ranked 26th.

286.title: Heroin worth more than ₹350 crore seized at Gujarat’s Mundra port
286.article_body: The anti-terrorist squad (ATS) of Gujarat and the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) seized more than 70 kg of heroin worth over ₹350 crore during a joint operation at Mundra port on Tuesday. Gujarat DGP Ashish Bhatia is likely to hold a press conference to share the details of the operation, The Indian Express reported.

287.title: Russian military equipment damaged in Ukraine go on display in Prague
287.article_body: Russian military equipment destroyed by Ukrainian Armed Forces amid the ongoing war has gone on display in the Czech Republic's capital, Prague. The exhibition features a damaged T-90 tank, Buk air defence system, Khosta self-propelled mortar, Msta howitzer and casings and fragments from rockets and missiles among other things. The exhibition was organised by Ukraine's Interior Ministry.

288.title: Social activist Medha Patkar booked for misusing donation funds
288.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh police have booked social activist Medha Patkar and 11 others for allegedly misleading people to donate to her trust for the welfare of the people of Narmada valley. The FIR also accuses them of misusing the funds for political and anti-national agenda. "We have...audit report...for every question regarding the financial status," Patkar said while refuting the allegations.

289.title: ODI format is great to bring Virat Kohli back into form: RP Singh
289.article_body: Ahead of India's first ODI against England, ex-India pacer RP Singh has said that the 50-over format is great to bring Virat Kohli back into form. "There's not too much pressure of scoring, his fitness is great so he can rotate strike consistently. The demands are higher in the T20 format," explained Singh. The first ODI will be played today.

290.title: SC extends Bhima-Koregaon case accused Varavara Rao's interim bail
290.article_body: The Supreme Court on Tuesday extended the interim bail granted on medical grounds to activist Varavara Rao in the Bhima-Koregaon case. "The interim protection enjoyed by the petitioner will enure to his benefit till further orders," the court ruled. Rao had challenged the April 13 order of the Bombay High Court rejecting his plea for permanent bail on medical grounds.

291.title: Bangladesh on standby to host Asia Cup amid crisis in Sri Lanka: Reports
291.article_body: The Asian Cricket Council has reportedly kept Bangladesh on standby to host the next month's Asia Cup tournament as the current host, Sri Lanka, is going through a political and economic crisis. The ACC does not want to take any risk in this matter and will arrive at a final decision later this month, a report said.

292.title: K'taka minister's gunman returns lost chain, minister shares owner's letter
292.article_body: Karnataka Health Minister K Sudhakar took to Twitter to share a letter by a lady who had lost her gold chain in mall. Sudhakar said that his gunman Anjan Kumar found and returned chain. "The letter penned by woman thanking Anjan makes me proud. Well done Anjan!" he wrote on Twitter. Letter said Anjan found the chain on July 10.

293.title: High resolution cameras to come up at Delhi bus stops, monitoring ideas invited
293.article_body: The Delhi transport department is planning to install high-resolution cameras at all bus queue shelters across city. An official said they have invited proposals from technology companies for ideas about ensuring that rules are being followed. "At present, volunteers and enforcement teams are there but we want some partners with solutions that end manual monitoring partially or fully," he added.

294.title: Noida Police arrests 3 for issuing fake visas, charging up to ₹65,000
294.article_body: The Noida Police arrested three men for allegedly issuing fake visas and cheating people by charging ₹40,000-₹65,000 each for issuing such visas. The accused ran their office under the name 'Om Consultancy' in Sector-2 and offered job opportunities to victims in Gulf countries, the police said. The police recovered 15 passports and four visas from their possession.

295.title: Shark Tank India's Aman Gupta meets Tom Cruise at Wimbledon, shares pic
295.article_body: Shark Tank India judge and boAt Co-founder Aman Gupta met actor Tom Cruise at the final of men's singles during the Wimbledon tennis championship in London. Sharing a picture with Cruise on social media, Gupta wrote, "Fan moment for me meeting the legend, Tom Cruise...Jerry Maguire is my all time favourite movie and I couldn't resist telling him that."

296.title: He was kind-hearted: Varun remembers Sidharth on 8 yrs of 'Humpty...'
296.article_body: Varun Dhawan has penned a note remembering late actor Sidharth Shukla as their film, 'Humpty Sharma Ki Dulhania', completed eight years of release. Sharing some pictures with Sidharth, he wrote, "He was kind-hearted, protective...and always passionate about work and friends." Director Shashank Khaitan also shared a post for Sidharth, saying, "Miss you Sid, still cannot believe you're not with us."

297.title: It's script over language for me: Rakul on not doing Telugu movies
297.article_body: Rakul Preet Singh, during a question and answer session on Instagram, responded to a fan who asked, "Will you do any Telugu project or [do you want to]...stick to only Hindi movies?" "Of course, I'd do a Telugu film...I'm just waiting to do something different...Right now, I'm busy with projects here but for me, it's script over language," Rakul responded.

298.title: He's got the best serve I have ever faced: Novak on Nick Kyrgios
298.article_body: Novak Djokovic said Australian tennis player Nick Kyrgios, who reached the final of Wimbledon 2022, has got the "best serve" he has ever faced. "He was cruising through his service games...It was...so difficult to read because he...always tosses at the same spot. He can hit all the angles," added Djokovic. Djokovic beat Kyrgios 4-6, 6-3, 6-4, 7-6(7-3) in the final.

299.title: Biggest Supermoon of 2022 to be visible on July 13-14
299.article_body: The biggest Supermoon of 2022 will be visible on July 13-14 as the Moon will be its closest to the Earth at a distance of 3,57,264 km. The full moon will appear slightly larger and brighter than usual for a couple of days. The phenomenon may cause tidal effects on the planet that may lead to coastal storms at sea.

300.title: Hyderabad police, other officials clear fallen trees from roads
300.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Monday tweeted that traffic police personnel along with other officials have cleared roads of trees that fell amid heavy rainfall. One of the trees was cleared from the Saibaba officers colony after the police received a complaint on their WhatsApp, while the other was cleared after it fell on the Choutuppal-Valigonda road, according to the police.

301.title: England Test side not a finished product yet: Brendon McCullum
301.article_body: England Test coach Brendon McCullum has said the Ben Stokes-led side is not a "finished product" and they need to ensure that their 'aggressive' approach becomes a norm for them. "That this style of play and what we're trying to achieve is completely authentic to us in any given situation and that will be the real challenge," he added.

302.title: Supporting Droupadi Murmu doesn't mean supporting BJP: Shiv Sena's Raut
302.article_body: Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut said that the party discussed NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu in their meeting on Monday. "Supporting Droupadi Murmu does not mean supporting BJP. Sena's role will be clear in a day or two," he added. "Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray will make a decision," Raut further added. "Sena does not take decisions under pressure," he stated.

303.title: Man accuses wife of stealing his pvt info for divorce case in Pune
303.article_body: A 40-year-old man has filed a complaint against his wife, father-in-law and his company's employees for allegedly stealing his private information from his office to use it in a divorce case in Pune. The complainant claimed that an office employee had forwarded information from his office computer to his father-in-law. The wife had filed a divorce case in 2019.

304.title: Sri Lanka President’s brother stopped from flying out amid crisis
304.article_body: Sri Lanka's former Finance Minister and President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's brother, Basil Rajapaksa was stopped from flying out of the country amid the ongoing economic crisis, immigration officials said on Tuesday. It was not immediately clear where Rajapaksa was trying to go. He resigned as Finance Minister in April as street protests surged against shortages of fuel, food, and other necessities.

305.title: Female Pakistani journalist slaps a boy on camera; issues clarification
305.article_body: A video of Pakistani journalist Maira Hashmi slapping a boy on camera has gone viral on social media. She could be seen reporting on the Eid al-Adha celebrations when she suddenly slaps the boy. Issuing clarification, she said that the boy was harassing a family and he didn't listen to her when she asked him to behave himself.

306.title: DM shouts on headmaster, orders to stop his salary for wearing kurta-pyjama in Bihar
306.article_body: The headmaster of a government school in Lakhisarai district of Bihar has been issued a show-cause notice after District Magistrate Sanjay Kumar Singh found him wearing a kurta and pyjama in the school premises. A video showed the DM shouting at the headmaster and  ordering to stop his salary for "looking like a public representative".

307.title: WhatsApp to now let users react to messages with any emoji of their choice
307.article_body: WhatsApp is rolling out a new update that will allow users to use any emoji as a reaction to text messages. Until now, users had the option of using six emojis: a thumbs up, a heart, a crying laughing face, a shocked one, a tearful one and joined hands. Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg announced the new feature on Facebook.

308.title: People trying to break Congress in Goa will fail miserably: Mukul Wasnik
308.article_body: Congress leader Mukul Wasnik said the people who tried to break Congress party in Goa "failed miserably". "Some people want to break the MLAs of different political parties, especially Congress...but Congress MLAs have shown them they're going to fail...miserably," Wasnik said. This comes after Congress accused some party leaders of conspiring with BJP to cause defections within the party.

309.title: TMC's Idris Ali is a terrorist: BJP MP Khan after statement on PM Modi
309.article_body: West Bengal BJP MP Saumitra Khan has called TMC MLA Idris Ali a "big terrorist" after the latter allegedly said that PM Narendra Modi will meet the same fate as Sri Lanka President Gotabaya Rajapaksa. Khan alleged that Ali is currently out on bail and is making such statements to please West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee.

310.title: PM violated constitutional norms: Owaisi on PM unveiling National Emblem statue
310.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi criticised PM Narendra Modi for unveiling bronze statue of India's National Emblem on top of the new Parliament building in Delhi and said that he (PM) violated all constitutional norms. Taking to Twitter, Owaisi said, "As head of government, PM shouldn't have unveiled the National Emblem...Speaker of Lok Sabha represents LS which isn't subordinate to government."

311.title: Would've destroyed Michael Jordan if I played against him: NBA star Morant
311.article_body: NBA player Ja Morant said he wishes he could have played against NBA legend Michael Jordan, adding that he would have "destroyed" Jordan. "I would have cooked Jordan," stated Morant. "Maybe you'll cook for Jordan, but you won't cook Jordan...It's...completely over the edge, delusional overconfidence, supreme overconfidence. It's just hard to swallow," read a reaction from commentator Skip Bayless.

312.title: UP woman poisons 3 kids, self over family dispute; all hospitalised
312.article_body: A woman allegedly poisoned her three children and then consumed poison herself over some family dispute in Uttar Pradesh's Hamirpur on Monday, police said. On noticing the children in an unconscious state, neighbours rushed all four of them to a hospital, police added. The woman did so as her husband and his brother were arguing over property, according to police.

313.title: Madhuri celebrates 25 yrs of Mrityudand, says 'Feels like yesterday'
313.article_body: Madhuri Dixit took to Instagram to share a few stills from her movie 'Mrityudand: The Death Sentence' to mark 25 years since its release. "Feels like yesterday. Gotta always strive to do our best. The journey continues...stay tuned #Milestone #Mrityudand #SilverJubilee," she captioned the post. Directed by Prakash Jha, the film also starred Shabana Azmi, Ayub Khan and Om Puri.

314.title: Truck hits vehicle in Suvendu Adhikari's convoy, 2nd such incident since July 1
314.article_body: A truck collided with a police vehicle in BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari's convoy near Kolkata's Kalikapur on Monday night, the police said and added that no one was hurt in the accident. Notably, this was the second such incident involving Adhikari's convoy since July 1. The truck driver has been arrested and he will be produced in court today.

315.title: If you don't want Kohli in your team, by all means, keep on the pressure: Swann
315.article_body: Former England cricketer Graeme Swann has said if Virat Kohli were an English cricketer, he would ask the media to take the pressure off the "star asset". He added, "If you do not want Virat Kohli in your team anymore, by all means, keep on heaping the pressure or if you value the asset, then go easy on him."

316.title: Russia, Belarus athletes might be banned from Paris Olympics 2024: IOC member
316.article_body: International Olympic Committee (IOC) member Craig Reedie has said that the Russian and Belarusian athletes might be banned from participating in the Paris Olympics 2024. "A decision is going to have to be taken on what happens to these two countries and my guess is that the general feeling would be that they should not qualify," Reedie said.

317.title: Chandigarh asks to axe 150-yr-old dry tree inside school for deaf, mute kids
317.article_body: The Chandigarh administration has written to its forest and wildlife department seeking permission to axe a 150-year-old heritage tree. Reports said the tree stands inside Vatika School for Deaf and Dumb Children in Sector 19. This comes days after a student of a city school died after a heritage tree fell on her during school hours.

318.title: Gurugram's 6-lane Sohna elevated road opens for traffic
318.article_body: The six-lane Sohna elevated highway constructed on National Highway 248 between Rajiv Chowk and Badshahpur was opened for traffic on a trial basis on Monday. The newly constructed highway will ease travel between Gurugram, Sohna and Alwar, and will also link Delhi-Mumbai Expressway. The 22 km length highway is built with a capital investment of about ₹2,000 crore.

319.title: BCom graduate who watched YouTube videos to steal cars arrested in B'luru
319.article_body: Police arrested a BCom graduate, Arun Kumar, for stealing cars in Bengaluru on Monday. According to police, he was previously jailed in a dacoity case, where a fellow inmate told him about an auto diagnostic tool that helps to break car locks. When he was out on bail, he purchased the tool, watched YouTube videos and started stealing high-end cars.

320.title: Video shows SpaceX rocket booster exploding during test, Musk responds
320.article_body: A rocket booster developed by SpaceX for its next-generation Starship spacecraft burst into flames during a ground-test firing on Monday in Texas. Responding to a livestream video recorded by the website NASASpaceflight, SpaceX CEO Elon Musk said, "Actually not good. Team is assessing the damage." It was not yet clear as to what caused the explosion.

321.title: Very heavy to extremely heavy rainfall warning in several states; IMD releases list
321.article_body: The India Meteorological Department has predicted isolated extremely heavy rainfall in Gujarat, ghat areas of Madhya Maharashtra and Goa till July 14. Meanwhile, isolated very heavy rainfall is likely over Madhya Pradesh, south interior Karnataka, Odisha, coastal Andhra Pradesh, Telangana and Chhattisgarh between July 12 and July 15.

322.title: 7,100+ people leave for cave shrine from base camp as Amarnath Yatra resumes
322.article_body: Another batch of 7,107 pilgrims left from base camp for cave shrine on Tuesday after Amarnath Yatra was resumed on Monday. Yatra had been halted after flash floods on Friday killed 16 people and injured 37. Reports said 15,000 people were rescued after flash floods. "Helicopter services for yatris continued from both base camps to cave shrine," officials said.

323.title: Car runs over biker after he hits another car's open door in Punjab
323.article_body: A 32-year-old biker was killed after he hit the door of a parked car when the driver opened it, following which he fell on the road and was run over by another car in Punjab's Zirakpur. The incident occurred on Sunday and the person riding pillion on the bike escaped without injuries. A complaint has been filed in the matter.

324.title: Bomb hurled at RSS office in Kerala's Kannur district: Police
324.article_body: A bomb was reportedly hurled at a Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) office in Payyannur in Kerala's Kannur district. The incident took place on Tuesday morning, Payyannur police informed. It reportedly did not cause any casualties. However, the window glasses of the building were broken in the attack, they added.

325.title: Model who spent ₹4.7 cr on 40 surgeries to look like Kim pays ₹95 lakh to be herself
325.article_body: Versace Model Jennifer Pamplona, after spending nearly $600,000 (over ₹4.7 crore) on procedures to transform herself into a Kim Kardashian lookalike, has now paid $120,000 (over ₹95 lakh) to "detransition" back to her former appearance. "People would call me a Kardashian and it started to get annoying. I was only being recognised because I looked like a Kardashian," Pamplona said.

326.title: Hear us out before taking a call on party symbol: Shiv Sena to EC
326.article_body: The Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena has moved to Election Commission (EC), asking it to hear it out before taking a view on any demands made on the party symbol by the faction led by Eknath Shinde, sources said on Monday. "It is kind of a caveat," an EC functionary said. Last month, nearly 40 MLAs walked out of Shiv Sena.

327.title: US First Lady criticised for comparing Latinos to 'breakfast tacos'
327.article_body: US First Lady Jill Biden is being criticised after she told a group of Latino voters in Texas that they were as "unique" as "breakfast tacos". "We are not tacos. Our heritage as Latinos is shaped by a variety of diasporas, cultures and food traditions, and shouldn't be reduced to a stereotype," the National Association of Hispanic Journalists (NAHJ) said.

328.title: SC extends Zubair's bail in Sitapur case, seeks UP govt reply
328.article_body: The Supreme Court on Tuesday extended the interim bail granted to Alt News Co-founder Mohammed Zubair until further orders in connection with the case registered in UP's Sitapur. Zubair has been booked for his tweets calling three Hindu seers "hatemongers". The court asked the state government to respond to the fact-checker's plea seeking quashing of the FIR within four weeks.

329.title: Over 40 people booked for protesting outside Punjab AAP MLA’s house
329.article_body: Around 40-50 unidentified persons have been booked for protesting outside the house of AAP's Ludhiana South MLA Rajinderpal Kaur Chhina on June 8, Ludhiana Police said. A group of persons sat outside the residence of the MLA alleging a lack of power and water supply in their area, police added. They also tried to block her way, police further said.

330.title: Karthik has looked confused whenever he's played more balls: Chawla
330.article_body: Talking about Dinesh Karthik, cricketer-commentator Piyush Chawla said, "Whenever...Karthik has got to play more balls, other than the South Africa series, he has looked...confused." Chawla added that Karthik is a dangerous player when given four to five overs to bat. Karthik scored 29 runs in the recently concluded T20I series against England. He had a strike rate of 93.54.

331.title: The Great Khali accused of slapping Punjab toll employee; video of argument goes viral
331.article_body: A video showing The Great Khali arguing with toll plaza employees in Punjab after they accused him of slapping one of their employees is going viral online. The employee said that the WWE wrestler slapped him when he asked for an ID. Khali could be heard accusing the staff of blackmailing him.

332.title: 3 killed, 5 critical as speeding SUV rams into autorickshaw in Odisha
332.article_body: Three villagers travelling in an autorickshaw were killed after a speeding SUV rammed into the auto on Tuesday morning on NH-57 in Odisha's Sonepur district. Five others were critically injured in the accident and are undergoing treatment at a hospital, reports said. According to police, all three deceased were vegetable vendors who were going to sell their weekly produce.

333.title: Fraudsters pose as YouTube officials, extort ₹4.68 lakh from Mumbai student
333.article_body: An MBA student in Mumbai was defrauded of ₹4.68 lakh by fraudsters after the latter posed themselves as YouTube officials. The fraudsters extorted the amount from the victim by threatening to upload the latter's video call conversation with a semi-nude woman, police said. The matter was reported to the police after the 23-year-old victim narrated the incident to his father.

334.title: 'Barfi!', 'Tamasha' won't work in theatres today: Ranbir Kapoor
334.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor has said films like 'Barfi!' or 'Tamasha' won't work in theatres today as most people would prefer to watch such content from the comfort of their homes. "But when you make a film like 'Shamshera', and you want...box office collection, you cannot release this film on OTT because it's made for a collective audience," he added.

335.title: He's India's very own Mr 360 degrees: Aakash on Suryakumar's 117-run knock
335.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said Suryakumar Yadav's 117-run innings against England in the third T20I was not just "bravado" but also a lot about game sense. "A sense of knowing where the fielders were and where the bowlers were likely to bowl. He's India's very own Mr 360 degrees," added Chopra. Suryakumar's innings included 14 fours and 6 sixes.

336.title: It's very natural: Rajkummar on comparison with Vishwak Sen in 'HIT...'
336.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao, on being asked about the comparisons of his performance in 'HIT: The First Case' with Vishwak Sen, said, "It's very natural for people to compare...when two actors perform similar roles." "Comparisons will be natural, but they won't affect me...because I won't read them," he added. 'HIT: The First Case' is a remake of Vishwak-starrer Telugu film 'HIT'.

337.title: Probe ordered over boy seen sitting with brother's dead body in MP
337.article_body:
Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra said on Monday that a probe has been ordered into a video showing an eight-year-old boy sitting with the dead body of his two-year-old brother on the roadside in Morena. He added that the boy's father was given ₹10,000 from the Red Cross. 
"Show cause notice was served to civil surgeon," he further said.

338.title: Noida liquor shops falling on Kanwar yatra route to be closed from July 14
338.article_body: Noida district administration said all the liquor and meat shops falling on the Kanwar yatra route in the district will remain closed from July 14. A massive checking campaign should be conducted during the Kanwar fair, DM Suhas LY said. "One of the major routes starts from Ghaziabad where 'yatris' enter the jurisdiction of Noida at Chilla border," police said.

339.title: Govt will bring new rules to reduce scope to violate laws : Union Minister on Uber Files
339.article_body: Speaking on The Uber Files, Union Minister Rajeev Chandrasekhar said it was "disturbing that the big tech platforms have used technology and innovations to evade scrutiny and bypass laws." He added that the government is now determined to bring in "new rules and laws that will reduce the opportunities for them to violate Indian laws or do something illegal."

340.title: Lawrence Bishnoi wants public apology from Salman for killing blackbuck: Police
340.article_body: Delhi Police officer HGS Dhaliwal has stated that gangster Lawrence Bishnoi said his community members won't forgive Salman Khan unless he tenders public apology over blackbuck's killing. "During interrogation, he candidly said that since Bishnois consider the blackbuck to be reincarnation of...Bhagwan Jambeshwar, acquittal or punishment from the court won't be the last verdict," Dhaliwal added.

341.title: Uber was not legal in most countries under my jurisdiction: Whistleblower
341.article_body: Uber Files whistleblower Mark MacGann, who leaked 124,000 internal documents, said the company "was not legal" in most countries under his jurisdiction. "[Uber] was willing to break all the rules...use its money and its power...to destroy [taxi drivers'] livelihoods," he said. "[Drivers] needed somebody to be angry at...I became that person," MacGann said, revealing that he received death threats.

342.title: Doctors must offer abortion if mother's life at risk: US Health Dept
342.article_body: The US Health and Human Services Department on Monday said that healthcare providers must offer abortion services if the life of a mother is at risk. The procedures would be protected under federal law regardless of state bans, the department added. This comes after US Supreme Court last month overturned a nearly 50-year-old ruling that legalised abortion across the country.

343.title: French PM survives no-confidence vote, calls it 'political tactics'
343.article_body: French PM Elisabeth Borne on Monday survived a motion of no-confidence brought against her by an alliance of left-wing lawmakers. The motion required an absolute majority of 289 votes for the government's fall, however, only 146 lawmakers voted in support of the no-confidence motion. Borne called the vote "political tactics". French President Emmanuel Macron appointed Borne as PM in May.

344.title: Elon Musk responds after Donald Trump calls him 'another bullshit artist'
344.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has responded after former US President Donald Trump called him "another bullshit artist". "I don't hate the man, but it's time for Trump to hang up his hat & sail into the sunset. Trump would be 82 at end of term, which is too old to be chief executive of anything, let alone US," Musk tweeted.

345.title: Mother buries 3-yr-old daughter alive in Bihar; rescued by villagers
345.article_body: A three-year-old girl was allegedly buried alive by her mother and maternal grandmother at a graveyard in Bihar's Saran district. When the villagers heard screams from the graveyard, they got scared thinking it was a ghost but later realised that someone was buried alive. They removed the soil and found the girl with her mouth stuffed with clay.

346.title: India shouldn't become police state, new bail law needed: SC
346.article_body: India should never become a police state, said the Supreme Court on Monday as it asked the Centre to consider bringing a new law "in the nature of a Bail Act" to regulate bails. The court noted that the jails are flooded with under-trial prisoners while the rate of conviction in criminal cases remains abysmally low in the country.

347.title: Dad had told me 'Never do a film where you need to wear a dhoti': Ranbir
347.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor said his late father and actor Rishi Kapoor had told him to "never" act in a film that requires him to wear a dhoti as such films "never work". "Always do commercial films," added Ranbir, elaborating on what Rishi shared. "My father used to [say that my films]...aren't going to make me a national star," he had stated.

348.title: Will put burden of ₹1,000 cr on govt: AIMIM MP on renaming Aurangabad
348.article_body: AIMIM MP Imtiaz Jaleel has criticised the decision to rename Aurangabad, claiming that a Delhi official told him that this puts a "burden of around ₹1,000 crore" on the government. Alleging that people would also have to bear the "burden of several thousand crores", he said, "It's not like [ex-Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray or NCP chief Sharad Pawar]...would..help you."

349.title: Fire brigade rescues 2 as part of Pune building collapses; 2 hurt
