349.article_body: Two people were injured and two others were rescued by the fire brigade after a part of an old building in Pune's Nana Peth area collapsed on Monday amid heavy rains. "It's a 70-year-old structure. The collapse...damaged around 30% of the structure," a fire officer said. The two injured people were taken to a hospital, the fire officer added.

350.title: 3 women pose as maids on Facebook, steal from homes in B'luru; arrested
350.article_body: The Bengaluru police have arrested three women who posed as maids and stole valuables from households. According to police, the women created a fake Facebook page titled 'Refer House Maids'. Once they received queries for housemaids, one of them used to start working and later fled with valuables, police added. All three are residents of Mumbai, police said.

351.title: Audiences want Hindi film tadka; KGF 2, RRR success proves it: Karan Johar
351.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar said the audiences want the 'tadka' of Hindi cinema. "The [success of] KGF: Chapter 2, RRR, and Pushpa: The Rise - Part 1 [proves theory]. We need to go back to [elements] we grew up on...drama, songs, dance, and emotions. The phase of small-town, high-concept movies is great, but this is reality of our time," he added.

352.title: BJP should clarify alleged links with Udaipur murder accused: Gehlot
352.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot alleged that BJP had links with the accused involved in the murder of Kanhaiya Lal in Udaipur and asserted that the party should issue a clarification. Gehlot further asked BJP to respond to allegations of helping one of the accused by requesting the police to drop a case filed against him for not paying rent.

353.title: Twitter shares fall by 11.3% after Elon Musk terminates $44 billion deal
353.article_body: Twitter shares fell 11.3% to $32.65 on Monday, two days after Tesla CEO Elon Musk terminated the $44 billion acquisition deal. In comparison to Musk's $54.20 bid, this is a 40% discount and the biggest daily percentage drop in over 14 months. Meanwhile, Tesla's shares closed down almost 7%. Notably, Twitter may file a lawsuit against Musk early this week.

354.title: I'm a thin guy, putting on muscle is hard; body building confuses me: Ranbir
354.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor, while talking about his physical transformation for 'Shamshera', said that "body building business confuses" him. "This was physically tough to do. I am a thin guy. So to lose weight is very easy for me, but to put on muscle is harder. It's very complicated," he said, adding that body building is an occupational hazard.

355.title: ISRO shares photos of double craters created by rocket hitting the moon
355.article_body: The Chandrayaan-2 mission of the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) has captured the site of impact on the moon after a used rocket hit the lunar surface. It shared before and after images of the lunar surface to show the difference after the impact. "The impact created a double crater which is 28 metre wide," ISRO said.

356.title: Siddaramaiah accuses Pralhad Joshi of conspiring against Yediyurappa
356.article_body: Congress leader Siddaramaiah accused Union Minister Pralhad Joshi of conspiring against BS Yediyurappa and removing him from the post of Karnataka CM. "Yediyurappa, who built BJP in Karnataka, was sent to jail...removed from the post of CM by whose conspiracy? Aren't you (Joshi) into it?" Siddaramaiah remarked. "Who finally removed him from the post of Chief Minister?" he tweeted.

357.title: Portugal on high alert as temperatures set to soar to 47°C
357.article_body: Bracing for soaring temperatures, Portugal on Monday raised its alert level to its third-highest of four levels. According to the weather agency IPMA, temperatures in some areas in Portugal could reach 46-47 degrees Celsius in the coming days. "This is not a very normal situation...It is serious in all aspects, even for our health," IPMA meteorologist Patrícia Gomes said.

358.title: Half of projected increase in population by 2050 to be concentrated in 8 nations: UN
358.article_body: The UN in its World Population Prospects 2022 report said that more than half of the projected increase in the global population between 2022 and 2050 is expected to be concentrated in just eight countries. The countries include India, Pakistan, Egypt, Ethiopia, Nigeria, the Democratic Republic of the Congo, the Philippines and the United Republic of Tanzania.

359.title: Video shows man riding motorbike with 6 children in UP; challaned
359.article_body: A video of a man riding a motorbike with six children in Uttar Pradesh's Auraiya district has gone viral on social media. When intercepted by the police, the man pleaded that he was taking the children for an ice cream treat after Bakri Eid and didn't have any other means of transport. The police issued him a challan.

360.title: FIR filed over sexual harassment of Delhi BJP woman spokesperson
360.article_body: A case of sexual harassment was filed after Delhi BJP complained that a woman spokesperson of the party was being defamed through a video posted on social media. The party said the video insulted the spokesperson's modesty electronically. The party further alleged that a group of people have been harassing its female spokespersons for the past two to three months.

361.title: Both Rishabh Pant and Karthik won't play, I want Pant: Vaughan on T20 WC
361.article_body: Former England captain Michael Vaughan said there is a "big question mark" on Virat Kohli's spot in the T20I side having scored 12 runs in the T20I series against England. Talking about the upcoming T20 World Cup 2022, Vaughan stated, "I don't think both [Rishabh Pant and Dinesh Karthik] will play. I want Rishabh in because he is left-handed."

362.title: Don't make Umran play T20Is, harden him in Tests: Madan Lal
362.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Madan Lal has said pacer Umran Malik should learn the craft of taking wickets in Test cricket. "Don't make him play T20 cricket. Get him to play Tests...harden him like that...He's a very good bowler but you have to make him a bowler," explained Lal. Umran conceded 56 runs in his four overs in the third England T20I.

363.title: IMD issues orange alert for Mumbai till July 14
363.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued orange alert warning for Mumbai till July 14. As per its forecast, the city and suburbs will have moderate to heavy rain for next 24 hours and there is possibility of very heavy rainfall in isolated places. Meanwhile, IMD issued red alert for Kolhapur, Palghar, Nashik, Pune, and Ratnagiri districts till July 14.

364.title: My unborn baby counts as passenger: US woman after being fined for carpool lane driving
364.article_body: A pregnant woman in US' Texas who was fined for driving solo in a carpool lane has said her unborn baby must be counted as a passenger. Brandy Bottone said her unborn child was a person in the eyes of the law as the US Supreme Court had days earlier reversed a federal law guaranteeing women access to abortion.

365.title: I was unsure whether it would work: Ranveer Singh on his OTT debut
365.article_body: Discussing his OTT debut with 'Ranveer vs Wild with Bear Grylls', Ranveer Singh said, "It was an experiment for me and I was unsure about whether it would work." "The good folks at Netflix...were way more confident than me," he added. "I was very excited to do something that hasn't been done before in the Indian entertainment space," stated Ranveer.

366.title: BJP looting people's money in name of development: Kumaraswamy
366.article_body: Former Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy criticised the BJP-led government in the state and at the Centre by calling it 'pro-rich'. "BJP government is looting people's tax money in the name of development," said Kumaraswamy. He further stated that if poor people are harassed in the country, then we too might witness a response similar to that of Sri Lanka.

367.title: Picture abhi baaki hai: Unacademy CEO on firm's cost-cutting measures
367.article_body: Responding to a journalist's tweet about the recent cost-cutting measures at the firm, Unacademy's CEO Gaurav Munjal tweeted, "Picture abhi baaki hai. Abhi intermission hua hai." Munjal on Monday announced a series of cost-cutting measures to turn the firm profitable. The measures included founders and the top management taking a salary cut and free meals being prohibited in their offices.

368.title: Bharti Singh and Haarsh Limbachiyaa reveal 3-month-old son's face
368.article_body: Bharti Singh and Haarsh Limbachiyaa have shared a video on their YouTube channel, revealing the face of their three-month-old son, Laksh, for the first time. Sharing the video, Bharti asked her fans if Laksh looks like her or Haarsh. Reacting to the video, a fan wrote, "So adorable...surely got Bharti's face," while another fan wrote, "Laksh is blessed with...best parents."

369.title: Ms Marvel is a moment for Pakistan, a celebration of who we are: Director
369.article_body: Pakistani-Canadian filmmaker Sharmeen Obaid-Chinoy, who helmed two episodes of 'Ms Marvel', spoke about how the show is a "moment for Pakistan". "So much of what you'd see...is a celebration of who we are and where we come from," she said. Sharmeen added the success of 'Black Panther' really pushed the narrative that superheroes could be in all colours and religions.

370.title: Delhi's neglected historical monuments to get facelift: Dy CM Sisodia
370.article_body: Delhi government has planned to give a facelift to its neglected historical monuments, Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said. While Malcha Mahal is set to get a makeover, museums will be set up at Dara Shikoh Library and Qudsia Bagh. Five monuments including, Birji Khan's Tomb, Bara Lao Ka Gumbad, Gol Gumbaz etc will be illuminated with tricolour lights, Sisodia said.

371.title: New UK PM to be announced on September 5
371.article_body: Britain's new PM will be announced on September 5, the ruling Conservative Party said. Eleven candidates have so far come forward in the race to replace Boris Johnson, who resigned last week after a revolt among his MPs and ministers. Johnson said that he'll not endorse any candidate running to replace him as he doesn't want to damage their chances.

372.title: England create history with 8-0 win over Norway in Women's Euro 2022
372.article_body: England defeated Norway by a record 8-0 margin in Women's Euro 2022 to register the biggest win in European Championship history. Notably, no side had ever scored eight goals in a single Euro match across men's and women's competitions. With the win, England have entered the quarter-finals after having won their first group stage game against Austria 1-0.

373.title: 15 key roads in south Delhi to be revamped for ₹23 cr: Sisodia
373.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia has approved projects for the revamping of south Delhi's 15 road stretches at an estimated cost of ₹23.24 crore and the work will start soon. The stretches, which have a total length of 18.19 km, are located in several areas including Kalkaji, Greater Kailash, Malviya Nagar and Kasturba Nagar, officials said.

374.title: List of state-wise active COVID-19 cases released
374.article_body: The Health Ministry on Tuesday stated that there are 1,31,043 active COVID-19 cases in the country, with Kerala accounting for the highest number of active cases at 26,643. This is followed by West Bengal (24,209), Tamil Nadu (18,802), Maharashtra (18,027), Karnataka (6,718), Telangana (5,166), Gujarat (4,214), Odisha (3,084) and Uttar Pradesh (2,305).

375.title: Don't have time for trolls, people don't get what I say most of the times: RGV
375.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma said he uses social media to talk about issues he is interested in and he does not have time for trolls. "I also feel most of the times, people don't get what I say and they tend to misunderstand me...I am always the first one to even apologise if I am wrong," he added.

376.title: Make education system more inclusive for special children: HC to Haryana
376.article_body: Punjab and Haryana HC asked the Haryana government to make the education system more inclusive for children with disabilities. HC was hearing a petition filed by a woman and her 16-year-old son with Down Syndrome, who was allegedly "maligned and expelled" from a school. The school alleged the boy's unruly and violent behaviour was the cause of his removal.

377.title: India reports 13,615 new COVID-19 cases, active cases rise to 1,31,043
377.article_body: India has reported 13,615 COVID-19 cases, 13,265 recoveries and 20 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 16,678 cases and 26 deaths. Notably, India's active COVID-19 cases jumped to 1,31,043, while the death toll reached 5,25,474.

378.title: SpiceJet MD booked for allegedly cheating Gurugram man, airline responds
378.article_body: Gurugram Police has booked SpiceJet Chairman and MD Ajay Singh for allegedly defrauding a businessman. The complainant, who's a consultant in the aviation sector, has accused Singh of delivering a fake depository instruction slip of 10 lakh shares for services provided to him. SpiceJet said the complaint is "mischievous and completely bogus" and intends to hurt SpiceJet and Singh's image.

379.title: Over 800 children died in specialised adoption agencies since 2018: Data
379.article_body: More than 800 children, maximum below the age of two, have died in state-run specialised adoption agencies since 2018, as per official data. The officials said that the main reason for the fatalities is unsafe abandonment, including children being found with dog bites. Of the total 819 children, 481 were girls and 129 those with special needs, according to data.

380.title: Rupee hits historic low of 79.57 against US dollar
380.article_body: The Indian rupee hit a historic low of 79.57 against the US dollar during early trade on Tuesday. On Monday, the currency had ended at another record low of 79.44 per US dollar and had witnessed an intra-day high of 79.24. Meanwhile, Sensex declined 305 points to 54,090 and Nifty slipped 108 points to 16,107 in early trade on Tuesday.

381.title: Uber Files whistleblower reveals himself
381.article_body: Mark MacGann, a career lobbyist who worked for Uber between 2014 and 2016, has revealed himself as the whistleblower who provided The Guardian with 1,24,000 company records that constitute The Uber Files. MacGann, a 52-year-old Irishman, served as Uber's chief lobbyist for Europe, the Middle East and Africa and oversaw government relations and public policy in more than 40 countries.

382.title: Ranbir did high intensity cardio, had low carb diet: Trainer on Shamshera
382.article_body: Talking about Ranbir Kapoor's fitness regime for 'Shamshera', his trainer Kunal Gir said, "We trained five days a week, each session was an hour-long, followed by a...high-intensity cardio session called 'truck'." "RK would hold the treadmill's handles...and drive the belt with his legs...Ranbir [had a low carb diet and] was allowed a cheat meal only once a week," he added.

383.title: 5 people arrested in Hyd Old City for stealing goats during Bakri Eid
383.article_body: Hyderabad police arrested five people for allegedly stealing goats a day before Bakri Eid. According to police, the five-member gang had stolen 23 goats kept at a house at Noori Nagar. The accused shifted the goats in an auto and sold them to customers at Pebbair area in Mahabubnagar, police said. They were apprehended with the help of CCTV footage.

384.title: I was illegally trafficked to UK aged 9, forced to work as child servant: Mo Farah
384.article_body: Multiple Olympic and world champion Mo Farah has revealed that he was illegally trafficked to Britain at the age of nine from Djibouti and forced to work as a child servant. The 39-year-old, who was born in Somalia, added his name had been changed to Mohamed Farah from Hussein Abdi Kahin in the fake travel documents.

385.title: Dwarka Expressway delayed, to now wrap up in 2023: Officials
385.article_body: The Dwarka Expressway, which is being built to reduce Delhi-Gurugram traffic on National Highway-8, has been delayed by at least a year due to COVID-19 pandemic, senior officials in National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) said. The expressway, which was earlier expected to be ready by this August, is now expected to be ready by September 2023, the officials said.

386.title: 3 senior Congress leaders join Aam Aadmi Party in Uttarakhand
386.article_body: Uttarakhand Pradesh Congress spokesman Rajendra Prasad Raturi, Pradesh Mahila Congress vice-president Kamlesh Raman and social media adviser Kuldip Chaudhary on Monday joined Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) in Delhi. They were inducted into AAP in presence of Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia. The leaders said they quit Congress as infighting was increasing despite the party's rout in the state Assembly polls.

387.title: Gap's India-born CEO Sonia Syngal steps down after over two years
387.article_body: American clothing retail company Gap's India-born President and CEO Sonia Syngal is stepping down from her position just over two years into the role. The 52-year-old was appointed as CEO in March 2020. The company did not provide a reason for her sudden exit. Gap's Executive Chairman Bob Martin will step in as interim CEO effective immediately, the company said.

388.title: Kohli just needs one good innings to return back to form: Deep Dasgupta
388.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Deep Dasgupta has said Virat Kohli only needs one good innings to return back to form. "Whenever he's playing, it doesn't look like he's out of form. I don't feel he played a bad shot [in the third England T20I], maybe it was just his luck," added Dasgupta. Kohli scored 12 runs in two T20Is against England.

389.title: TMC leaders insulted Hindu Gods earlier too: Smriti Irani
389.article_body: Union Minister for Women and Child Development Smriti Irani reacted to TMC MP Mahua Moitra's "Kaali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting goddess" remark and said that it is not "impossible" for TMC MP to insult the goddess. "TMC leadership had in the past several times insulted Hindu Gods and Goddesses," she said during her visit to West Bengal's Howrah.

390.title: Measures to decongest Hebbal junction working: B'luru authorities
390.article_body: The Bengaluru city traffic police on Monday said that the measures taken to reduce congestion at Hebbal junction have yielded results and the commuters are saving eight to 10 minutes while crossing the flyover. "There is improvement in traffic movement," said BBMP Chief Commissioner Tushar Giri Nath. Notably, the authorities have been tasked with finding ways to decongest the city.

391.title: Twitter user asks Mahindra about Tata Motors, he says 'Privilege to have such competitors'
391.article_body: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra responded to a Twitter user who asked him his feelings about Tata cars. Mahindra wrote, "It's a privilege to have strong competitors like Tata Motors. They keep reinventing themselves and that inspires us to do even better...Competition spurs innovation." Commenting on his tweet, a user wrote, "There are few people who praise [their] competitors."

392.title: Iran to send hundreds of drones to Russia for use in Ukraine: US
392.article_body: Iran is planning to send "hundreds" of unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs), including weapons-capable drones, to Russia for use in its ongoing war in Ukraine, US National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan said on Monday. US intelligence also indicates that Iran is preparing to begin training Russian forces on how to operate these drones as early as this month,  Sullivan added.

393.title: 2 minor boys engaged in child labour at 2 firms rescued in Hyd
393.article_body: The Sheteams of Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police along with the Muskan team have rescued two minor boys engaged in child labour at MGS packing solutions and SS Polymers Private Limited companies, the police said on Monday. The owners of the companies were counselled, the police added. The police further said that the companies are located under the Choutuppal Police Station limits.

394.title: Delhi govt starts issuing fine for violating plastic-ban
394.article_body: Delhi government has started penalising violators found using, selling, manufacturing or stocking single-use plastic items. They imposed a fine of ₹1.2 crore on 119 violators and seized 16,359 kg of banned plastic on Monday. The ban came into force on July 1 but offering a grace period of 10 days, government had said it'd penalise the violators from July 11.

395.title: Ex-sarpanch of village near Pune killed as wooden shed collapses on her
395.article_body: A 46-year-old former sarpanch of a village near Pune was killed after a wooden shed of her house collapsed on her on Monday amid heavy rains, police said. The incident took place when she was working in the space under the wooden structure, police added. The victim was rushed to a hospital where she succumbed to her injuries during treatment.

396.title: Pune's Alandi civic body head's daughter-in-law found dead; 3 booked
396.article_body: A case has been filed against Pune's Alandi Municipal Council chairperson, her husband and son following allegations of suicide due to harassment after her 24-year-old daughter-in-law was found dead. The deceased, who got married last year, was reportedly found hanging at her residence on Sunday evening. The body has been taken for post-mortem, the police said.

397.title: 7 die in 24 hrs as heavy rains lash Gujarat, over 9000 relocated; 468 rescued
397.article_body: At least seven people died in 24 hours as flood-like situation was caused following heavy rains lashing several parts of south and central Gujarat districts. Officials, on Monday, said that over 9,000 people were relocated and 468 were rescued. Dang, Navsari, Tapi, and Valsad districts in south Gujarat and Panchmahal, Chhotaudepur, and Kheda in central Gujarat were affected.

398.title: 'James Bond' theme composer Monty Norman passes away at 94
398.article_body: British composer Monty Norman, best known for writing the iconic theme music for the James Bond films, died on Monday at the age of 94, his official website announced. "It is with sadness we share the news that Monty Norman died on 11th July 2022 after a short illness," read the statement.

399.title: India's cricket squad for Commonwealth Games 2022 announced
399.article_body: The BCCI have announced India's cricket squad for the upcoming Commonwealth Games (CWG) 2022, which will feature women's T20I cricket. The squad will be led by Harmanpreet Kaur, while Smriti Mandhana has been named the vice-captain. The squad includes Shafali Verma, Pooja Vastrakar, Harleen Deol and Jemimah Rodrigues, among others. India will face Australia on July 29.

400.title: Shaadi.com Founder offers to find Nagaland Minister a bride; he says 'Waiting for Salman'
400.article_body: After Nagaland Minister Temjen Imna Along confirmed that he's not married and shared a screenshot of Google query of people seeking to know about his wife, Shaadi.com Founder Anupam Mittal replied, "Will have to do something @ShaadiDotCom." Responding to Mittal's tweet, Temjen said, "Bhai filhal hum bindas hai (Brother, I'm fine right now). Waiting for Salman Bhai."
